div.p: MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 1 Pope Eugenius [IV] confirms their possessions to D. [Torn and partly obliterated.] 29 Sept. 1431–47.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 2 Letter of Hubert Walter, archbishop of Canterbury, to the faithful of Lincoln and Coventry dioceses, granting a remission of 15 days’ penance to those who, after confession, give alms for the repair of the offices of the monks of D., ‘que sicut presente vidimus corruerunt et dirute sunt’. To last for 3 years. c. 22 Apr. 1201.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 1a Bull of pope Innocent [III] confirming to D., in general terms, all its possessions, and particularly all those churches which it has to its own use. Given at the Lateran. 28 Nov. 1210.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 2 Richard son of Hubert of Middleton, with the consent of Beatrice his wife, the daughter of Richard of Foxton, grants to D. all the the churches, lands and possessions which the said Richard of Foxton gave to them. To hold in free alms as R. of F. gave them. They are to be free of suit to his court and he is to acquit them of the forinsec service. Witnesses: William of D., kt., Nicholas of Noh’, Robert son of Philip of Lubeho, Roger Gulafre, Nigel of D., Richard of Foxton, William Mauchouenant. c. 1240.See Farrer, Honours & Knights’ Fees, ii, pp. 367–8. Circular seal, 1⅛″, in red wax (broken): a star and crescent.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 181 Attestation of Robert, bp. of Lincoln (given at the Island of Barberam), of a judgment (given at Lyons, 6 Kal. June, 7 Innocent IV) of John de Toleto, cardinal of St. Laurence in Lucina, in a cause between the abbey of Cluny and D. 29 May 1250.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 17 Fulk, archbishop of Dublin, grants an indulgence to benefactors of D. Given at D. [Mutilated.] 1 May 1271.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 3 Henry of Lancaster, earl of Derby, confirms to D. all the lands, &c., which Thomas fitz-Walter of D. gave them. Given at Kenilworth. [French.] 11 Oct. 1338. With the Earl’s seal in red wax, on a tongue.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 4 ‘Ceste endenture faite parentre les Priour et Covent de D. persones de leglise parochiele assise deinz meisme le Priorie et les bones gentz de meisme la ville parocheins de leglise parochiele avandite, tesmongne qe come certeins debatz et descensions ont este parentre eux, a cause qe les ditz parochiens ont fait sonner les sonettes deins meisme leglise les iours par la matin devant la heure de la levee des ditz Priour et Covent, si sovent et en tiel manie qe mesmes ceux Priour et Covent eut on teste disaisez, destourbez de leur quietee, e mesme, ben disposez de faire divine le iour enapres, considerant leur lever a mye nuyt pur matynes dire come leur ordre requiest. Et aussi par cause qe les Priour et Covent susditz ont fait chacier et rechacier leur charetter et autres cariages deinz et parmye le cimiteire de la dite eglise claymantz de lavoir chemyn a leur ease, quele chose soeffrer, semblar as ditz parochiens estre a eux dishoneste et grevante
acause qe leur ancestres et amys la feurent ensevelez. Les parties avandites par le ben et quiete de lune partie et de lautre, et pur eschuyer tiel (?) debatz et discensions en temps avenir, sont accordez en la presence del trespuissant prince Johan Duc de Guyene et de Lancastre en manie qe sensuyt. Cestassavoir qe les ditz parochiens ferront soner devant la messe deinz la dite eglise les iours en la matin en covenable pele et soner ave une sonette, a la levacioun del sacrament de meisme la messe trois knyllynges tantsoulement devant la levee des Priour et Covent avantditz. Et aussi qe les ditz Priour et Covent par eux et par leur tenantz auront une chemyn a leur ease en manie come ils ont euz dancien temps pur chacier et rechacier eux cariages selonc ce qe leur busoignera deinz la dite cimiteire sanz destourber divine service acelebrer deinz leglise parochiele avandite et sur meisme la cimiteire serra une porte fermer de serrure ove deux cliefs des quex lun serra en la garde des ditz Priour et Covent et lautre en la garde des parochiens avantditz. En tesmoignance de quele chose lavandite Duc as parties dycester endentures ad fait mettre son seal. Don a Kenilleworthe le xviij iour de Marcz lan du regne nostre tresredoutes le Roy Richard second puis le conquest treszisme. 18 March 1390. N.B. Only a fragment of the Duke’s seal is left. An English translation of this deed is printed, from the Daventry Cartulary in the British Museum (Cott. MS. Claud D. xii) in V.C.H. N’hants. ii, p. 112.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 5 Pope Nicholas adds the vicarages of Daventry, North Staverton, and West Haddon to D. Given at S. Peter’s, Rome. 20 Aug. 1451.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6 A parchment book (bound in 1929), folios 1–11d., about 10½″ × 13″. ‘Missus Gabriel de coelis’=Chevalier, Repertorium Hymnologicum no. 11636, which see for references to printed editions. This prose or sequence in honour of the Virgin Mary was in common use from the end of the twelfth century. f. 1. A rental of the lands assigned to the Chapel of S. Mary, between 1250–1288. It is here given in full because it provides a terminus ante quem for dating grants of land to the Chapel. f. 1. d. ‘Memorandum quod anno domini 1250 in vigilia s. Thome apostoli voli[intate] et assensu dompni Nicholi tunc prioris ac tocius conventus, Willelmus de Norton tunc sac[rista] assignavit lampadi in capella beate virginis ardenti, 18d. a Galfrido portario et eiusdem heredibus in perpetuum percipiendos. Item uni cereo
ad missam beate Marie ardenti 3/- de Simone de Bredone et eius heredibus inperpetuum percipiendos. f. 1. d. Item custos capelle capiet inperpetuum ex assignacione dompni Simonis Gemme de heredibus Simonis Ruffi 2/- ad sustentacionem unius cerei. Item custos capelle percipiet in perpetuum 12d. ad assumptionem beate V. de Thoma le escrivein et heredibus suis videlicet de domo []us in Draitone 6d. et de Othulcroft 6d. [Down to here was written at the same time.] Item supprior Anselmus assignavit inperpetuum ad sustentacionem unius cerei toto die ardentis in celebracione misse in capella eiusdem v. de ½ virgate terre de Waldegrave 3/- sacrista recip. De Broutone 3/6 custos capelle percipiet sed solvit inde in cena † domini 13d. ad mandat.’ 1250–78. Written together. De Radulfo Lovel de Weletone 12d. ad f. S.J.B. Written together. De Thoma fabro de Stavertone 6d. ad f. S. Michaelis et ad Pascham. Written together. Item sacrista debet invenire cotidie 2 cereos ardentes ad missam S. M. pro primis fundatoribus domus. Item debet invenire unum cereum pro priore Nicholas unde percipit 3/- de Waltero Peirecourt de Everdone et eius heredibus. Written together. Item prior Johannes assignavit 12/- de una virgata terre in Coldessebi ad sustinendos 4 cereos cotidie in eadem missa. Custos capelle percipit ad 4 terminos. Written together. De Waltero de Walwardintone et eius heredibus ½d. ad assumpcionem be. v. pro dim. acre terre quam tenet de Johanne fabro. [A different hand.] De Galfrido Capel de Watford et heredibus eius inperpetuum ad pentecosten 6d. et ad Natale domini 6d. [See D. 6, no. lxii.] 1273-88. [Another hand.] De Alicia et Margeria filiabus Willelmi Keth de Preston, 1d. infra Octabis Pentecost’ pro tribus acris terre quas tenent in eadem de perquisicione patris earum cum Wardis, releviis, eschaetis et omnibus aliis suis pertin. qualitercunque de eadem terra provenientibus in futurum. Item De Hugone de Baddeby in Preston. 1d. infra Octabis Pent’ pro iii ac. terre de eodem feodo & de perquisitione supradicti Willelmi Keth de Preston cum Wardis [as above].’ A cartulary of the Chapel of S. Mary, of the late fourteenth century. Modern numbers in Roman numerals are assigned to the charters. [D. 6, no. i–lxv.] ff. 2–10d. A rental of lands in Broughton (5 Sept. 1484). f. 10d.
Two sequences in honour of St. Augustine—Augustine par angelis and Summe presul Augustine—appear to be otherwise unknown. Daventry priory was dedicated to St. Augustine. f. 11. A rental of the Chapel lands in 1288. f. 11d. Daventry: William de Campedene 4/- William Smart 2/- Simon Newbold 6d. Robert Day 1d. Elyas de la Launde 4d. Drayton: Geoffrey the porter 1/6 [see D. 6, no. xxxviii]. Robert le Werrur 12d. Ralph apparitor 6d. The heirs of Walter de Wolwardyngtone ½d. Norton: John le Ferrur 2/- [see D. 6, no. lii]. Robert the skinner 6d. Broughton: Richard ad fontem 3/6 [see D. 6, no. lix]. Staverton: Thomas the smith 6d. West Haddon: Thomas Doute 6d. Watford: Geoffrey Capel 12d. [see D. 6, no. lxii]. Robert ad fontem 12d.

MS. Rolls Northants. 4 The witnesses to the second deed on roll 4 (an agreement between Walter fitz-Simon and D. made in the presence of the Archdeacon of Northampton in the Church of St. Andrew, Northampton) are: Sir John de Houton, archdeacon of Northampton, Master Richard his official, Paul Peyuere, Master Adam de Lincoln, William de D., Simon de Trop, Roger Golafre, Gilbert de Pateshulle, Robert de D., Henry de Burgo, Gilbert de Turs,Died 1233. Farrer, op. cit., p. 97. Walter Jordan. 1231–33. To the third: Sirs Roger de Welton, Symon de Trop, Hugh de Capes, … de D., kts., Jordan de D., Robert Maulore, John Gemme. 12 June 1254. To the fourth, a quit-claim of the prior to Sir Walter fitz-Simon: Sir William of D., kt., William fitz-Nigel, Jordan …, … John Bayuel, John de Neubolt, Roger the Porter. 1254–55.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 7 Walter fitz-Robert grants to D., for the safety of his soul, and that of Matilda de Buhun his wife, the mill which William of Drayton had wrongfully erected by his house. At his petition the
monks have granted the mill to William and his heirs for 12d. a year. William and his son have sworn ‘super textum ecclesie’ that they will not allow corn of the grantor or of any one else in the vill to be brought to the mill, except corn necessary to his own house, nor will they bring to the mill water other than that of S. Etheldrede’s well. If they break this agreement the mill shall be razed. Witnesses: Lady Margaret de Buhun, Lady Matilda de Bohun, wife of the grantor, and Humphrey the chaplain, Ivo the clerk, Philip de D., Roger de Heyford, Ralph Boterel, Osbert Cranmocville, Wiscard the knight, Eadmund the clerk, William de Haw, William son of Hamo, John de Verin, Thomas de Heyford, Kai de Lichesbarne, Osbert Rufus, Gruganus de D., Ralph the cook and Simon his brother, Walter of Heddan, Geoffrey the porter, Henry son of Swein, Henry de Nuiers, William de Heirunville, Ralph de camera, William fitz-John, Stephen Turpin, Aubord’ Pucin, Robert the cook; William Gemme, who surrendered the mill into the lord’s hand when he made this gift, as that which he ought not to erect or hold against the liberty of D., was also a witness. c. 1180–1198.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 8 Rein’ prior of D. grants to William the miller and his heirs the mill of Cudon. Rent: 20/-, for the payment of which William son of Suelf of Falewelle, William the cook, Galant, and Peter, are pledges. Witnesses: Simon the chaplain, William the priest of Estenestun, William the dean of Berchich, and Sanson his brother, Stephen de Esseby, Ingald the miller, Robert the cook, Simon fitz-Hugh de Seinliz, Alan son of Burkman, Walter the miller. c. 1170–90. Seal of the monastery in brown wax.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 9 John Swirkedale grants to D. in free alms, the house next to his house on the south, which master William of Cornwall once held from him, with the third part of his curtilage and croft. Witnesses: Henry the priest, William the knight of D., Ralph de Trop, Alan Gemme, Simon Campioun, Nigel, Roger the porter. c. 1240–50. Circular seal, broken, in red wax: a fleur-de-lys: S’ … DALE.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 10 Nicholas, prior, &c., of D. quit-claims to Roger the miller the tithes of their three mills in D. which he held from them, namely, one windmill and two water-mills, of which one is called Middilmilne and the other Cuttulemilne. Rent: 12d. Roger quit-claims his right in any suit of two mills—one horse-mill and one
water-mill, which they held; the former in their courtyard, the latter in the lower stock-pond. He further quit-claims his right in their wood called Armele, and is to pay 6d. for the tithes of his windmill which he holds from Walter fitz-Simon, lord of D. in Drayton. Witnesses: Sir Walter fitz-Simon, lord of D., Sir Simon de Trop, Roger Gulafre, William son of Nigel, John Gemme, John Baivel, Walter son of Jordan, John of Neubolt, Roger the porter. 3 April 1244. Circular seal, 1¼″, in white wax: a fleur-de-lys: SIGILL’ ROGERI MOLENDINARII.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 11 Roger the miller grants to D. in free alms that acre of land in Boclande which he bought from Geoffrey Bracur. Witnesses: William the knight of D., John Baiuel, William son of Nigel, Henry Cook, William Plumstone, Roger the porter, Geoffrey the porter, Henry the smith, John of Niuuebold. c. 1240–50. Seal, as in no. 10, in red wax.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 12 John son of Thomas Swirkedale of D. grants for the sake of his soul, the souls of his relatives, of Geoffrey the miller, and of Agnes the daughter of Geoffrey the miller, his right [in the mill] called Middelmulne. Witnesses: Sir Robert fitz-Walter, lord of D., William of Wolton, Robert Mallore, Philip of D., kts., Henry the smith, William Plumstone, Philip of Boudon, William Gemme. [Torn.] 1255–c. 1260. Circular seal, 1⅛″, in brown wax: an ornamental ‘S’. . . . S’JOH … SVIRKED’.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 13 Juliana Swyrkedale, widow of John S., quit-claims to D., all her right in Middelmulne with toft and croft, &c. Witnesses: Robert le Werrer, John the smith, Thomas of Gant, Robert le Waleis, John Eyr. c. 1270–80. Pointed oval seal, 1⅛″×¾″, in brown wax. A formal device something like a fleur-de-lys.—… IANE . SVIRKES …

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 14 Geoffrey son and heir of Roger the miller of D. quit-claims to D. his right in Cuttele mill, which his father held from them. Witnesses: Jordan son of Nigel, John of Naiboth, William Plumstone, Richard de Boudone, Simon Gamel. c. 1260–70. Seal, as in no. 15, but broken.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 15 Geoffrey son of Roger the miller of D. grants to D. the croft lying between the Almoner’s croft and the Welton road, for which they gave him 3 marks. Witnesses: Sir Robert fitz-Walter, kt., Sir Philip of D., kt., John Gemme, William Plumstone, John of Neubot, Henry the smith, Jordan of Uptrop. c. 1270–80. Pointed oval seal, 1⅜″ × ⅞″, in red wax. An elaborated cross: S’ GALFRIDI FIL’ ROG’I.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 16 John son of Roger the miller of D. quit-claims to Peter, prior, &c., of D. his right in all their mills (whether water-, wind-, or horse-) with adjacent crofts. Witnesses: John fitz-Philip of D., Simon de aula of the same, Robert Waleys of the same, Thomas de pistrino of the same, Robert of Weleton.Numbers D. 16 and 17 are in the same hand, and look as if they were written at the same date. c. 1300–1310. Seal, pointed oval, 1⅜″ × ¾″, in green wax: a long-necked bird(?) S’ JOHIS CARPUNT’.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 17 Peter, prior, &c.; of D. grant to John son of Roger Miller of D. for his service, 2 acres of arable land in D. and Drayton viz. in the south field of D. 3 half acres lying at le Loch by the land of Simon de aula. In the south field of Drayton a half acre over Putforlong between the monks’ land and that of William of Drayton. Rent 2d. For this grant John gave the prior; &c., an acre of arable land ‘cum divisa eidem adiacente’ in the south field of Drayton over Ryenhul by the land of John Neel, on which acre Ryenhulmylne was situated, which acre and mill Roger, father of the said John, used to hold from the monks. Witnesses: John fitz-Philip of D., William of Draytone of the same, Symon de aula of the same, Robert Gemme of Drayton, Robert le Werrour of the same, Geoffrey Gamel of the same. John son of William Adam. 1289–1318. Seal, as no. 16.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 18 Simon de aula of D. grants to Adam the miller of the same for his homage and service, and a sum of money, a certain house ‘placete mee’ in D. by the grange of Thomas le Barkere, 14 feet in length by the royal way, and in breadth from the high road to the court of Alice Swyrkedale. Rent 16d. If he fails to pay for a year and a day he may be distrained. Witnesses: Thomas Barker, Robert Waleis, John Godchep, William Launwal, Geoffrey Child. c. 1290–1300.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 19 Robert, son of John the miller of D., and Matilda his wife sell to John le draper of the same and Matilda his wife a portion of their court in D. lying by the tenement of the said John and Matilda, 11 feet in width from the wall of their cellar to John Bateman’s wall. Given at D. Witnesses: Symon de aula, John Runysche, Ralph de bracino, John Londy, William Fische, Robert Waleis, Geoffrey de [P]ost. 9 July 1318.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 178 [ …] son of Robert grants to William Gemme of D. and his heirs a messuage and virgate of land in D., which Gladwin held, and Gladwin himself. Witnesses: John de cruil, Richard son of Bald[win], Henry son of Hugh, Teobald Pasce, Nicholas de Writel, William de Blie, Walter de Kapel, William loci, Reginald son of Geoffrey, Richard de Stores , clerk, Roger de Penrete, Alan son of William, Walter Bige. [Mutilated.] c. 1200–10.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 1b William fitz-John of D. grants to D. in free alms Henry son of Sekeri, with all his issue, so that he shall be ‘liber homo S. Augustini’. Witnesses: S[imon] Camp[ion], Nigel, John Baiuel, Roger the porter []. c. 1210–20.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 177 Cecilia late the wife of … of D., quit-claims to D. all her right by way of dower in a house in D. Witnesses: Sir William Nel of D., … Bayuel, Henry the smith, William Plumstone, John de Neubolde, … John Gemme, … John le Werrour, Robert de Anesty, Roger le porter. [Partly obliterated.] 1220–30. Seal.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 7 Indenture by which D. grants to Thomas … half their manse and toft which Alberic once held of them in D. Rent 4/- and one man’s work 3 days in the year (i.e. one mowing, two reaping). Witnesses: Nigel, … Gemme, John Baiwel, Henry the cook, William Plumstone, Geoffrey Long, Henry the smith, William the butcher, ——, Robert de Neubolt. c. 1200–20.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 20 William son of Hamo, with the consent of Vivian his wife, grants to the sacristy of D. 12d. and 3 days’ labour, yearly. Witnesses: William the cellarer and sacristan, Simon the priest,
Gilbert famulus of William, and William son of William son of Hamo. [Mutilated.] c. 1230–40. Seal.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 182 William Galien grants to Thomas the chaplain, son of William de Witton, 2 acres of land, of which one is called Bauncroft [? or Burncecroft], and a manse, and the other is near the wood he held. For which the said Thomas gave 20/-. Witnesses: Henry [], Henry de Berecote, Thomas Alewy. c. 1240–50.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 21 Simon son of William le rus of D., quit-claims to D. all his right in a messuage which Thomas the mason once held from him by his house. For which they have given him 24/-. Witnesses: Sir Robert fitz-Walter lord of D., John of Neubolt, William Plumstone, Henry the smith, Henry of Faluesl’, John Bricin’, William le rus. 1255–c. 1265.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 22 John the dean, son of Robert brother of Master William rector of the church of Wlfamescote, quit-claims to D. in free alms that messuage in D. which Robert his father once held from them, viz. that by the house which belonged to John Plumston, with the croft appurtenant. He has also given back the charter which the said R. had from them about the said messuage. Witnesses: William of D., kt., Nigel of D., John Gemme, John Baiuel, Henry the cook, William Plumstone, Roger the porter, William de sartrin’. c. 1230–40. Fragments of small red oval seal: a sort of fleur-de-lys.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 23 Indenture by which the prior, Nicolas, and the convent of D. grant to Simon of Bredon for his homage and service half the messuage which John the dean once held from them with half the adjacent croft, in fee simple. Rent: 6/-. The strip adjacent to the said toft (sic) is not to be sold or separated from it. Witnesses: John Gemme, William son of Nigel, Henry the cook, William Plumstone, Roger the porter, William Punce. 1231–1258.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 24 Indenture by which Nicholas, prior, &c., grants to William Launval of D. and his heirs for his homage and service that messuage and croft in D. which Simon of Bredon once held from them. Rent: 6/-. William and his heirs are not to sell or alienate
the messuage or strip appurtenant. Witnesses: John Gemme, William Plumstone, Henry the smith, John of Neubot, Jordan of Uptrop. 1259–64.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 25 Adam son of Simon of Bredon quit-claims to his lords the prior convent of D. his right in a messuage in D. which his father held from them by this charter, which he has returned to them. Witnesses: William Plumstone, Henry the smith, John of Neubot, Richard of Boudon, Jordan of Uptrop. Given at D. 25 March 1258.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 26 Roger the porter of D. grants to William his son, for his homage and service, (i) that manse in D. which is between the manse of William de B—— on one side and that of Walter de Braibroc on the other; (ii) one a[cre] of land—½ an acre in the south field reaching to the Baddeby road, and ½ an acre in the north field, lying over ‘le Lome’. Rent: a pair of gloves worth ½d. at Easter, for all service saving the principal service pertaining to the manse: also he is to keep a lamp burning while mass is sung in the parish church of D. for the soul of the grantor, Matilda his wife, &c., Witnesses: John Gemme, William fitz-Nigel, Geoffrey the porter, Robert fitz-Nigel, John de Neubold, Henry the smith, Jordan of Draitone. [Torn.] 1244–57.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 27 Sir Philip of D., knight, grants to Jordan of D. for his homage and service, that virgate in D. which Henry ad fraxinum once held, with a messuage, and half a meadow called Monemede in D. Rent: 25/-. Witnesses: Sir Ralph de Thrope, William Gulafre of Nortone, Master William of D., William Gemme, William Plumstone, Henry the Smith, Gilbert the Frenchman of Staverton, John his brother of the same. c. 1255–1264. Endorsed (twice) in the same hand: ‘TRANS’.’

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 184 Simon Pinnoc of D. grants to D. and the almonry ½ acre of land with one headrig of a meadow belonging to the same behind Langedon in D., which John Plumstone gave to the said Simon in exchange for a half acre of land in Drayton. Witnesses: John fitz-Philip of D., kt., John Nel of the same, Master William of Drayton, Thomas de pistrino, Simon de aula, William de Campedone. c. 1280–1300.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 185 Amabilia de Braunceston relict of the late Simon Pinnoc of D., quit-claims to D. all her right by way of dower in one half acre of land and one headrig of meadows pertaining to it, behind Langedone in D. Witnesses: John Scop of … le Tanur of the same, Symon de aula, William de Campedon, John Adam of Draiton. c. 1280–1300.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 33 Agnes late the daughter of William the smith in D. quit-claims to Geoffrey Herberd of Troph for a sum of money all her ’placea’ in D. with houses, buildings easements, &c., lying in le Browund by the messuage of William Yrenhel, extending from the highroad to William Launwal’s croft and stretching southward from William Yrenhel’s messuage. Witnesses: … de Twe in Weletone, John Osbern of Falkelyme, John Hawyse, …, … Werrour of Drayton, Robert de Weletone in D., Simon of … Dec 1297.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 189 Geoffrey [Herberd] quit-claims to William Yrenhele (?) of D. and Matilda his wife, the whole of his plot of land in D., with houses thereon in le Brockend, by the messuage of the said William and Matilda which the granter bought from a certain Agnes daughter of the late William the smith. William of Drayton in Daventry, Robert de … leton of the same, Simon de aula, John Scop, Robert … Godfrey de Spinet. [Mutilated.] 2 July 1298.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 70 Walter le coupere of Wheltone appoints Simon Werreur of Draytone by D. to deliver seisin to Emma le coupere of D. of a messuage in D. in le Brokende, with curtilage and houses, between the messuages of John son of Robert of D. and Richard Hobbes of Bukkeby and Joan his wife and the grantor’s daughter. Given at D. 13 May 1352.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 28 Richard son of Robert of Neubolde in D. quit-claims to D. in free alms a chace lying between the tenement late of John the cook on the east and that of John Wyleys on the west: extending also from the said Richard’s land to the Prior’s croft. Witnesses: John fitz-Philip of D., Symon Baldewyne of the same, Simon de aula of the same, Robert le Werur of Drayton, Geoffrey Gamel of the same, John son of Adam of the same. c. 1280–90.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 29 Indenture by which the same Richard grants to Peter, prior of D., &c., in free alms half his ditch in D. between his croft and that of the monks, extending from the lower angle of his curtilage to the monks’ bank by le Inmede, that they may make a wall. Witnesses: William of Drayton, Simon de aula, Geoffrey de aula, Thomas le Barkere, John Scoph of D. 1289–c. 1300.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 30 Indenture by which Richard son and heir of the late Robert de Neubolde in D. with the consent of John fitz-Philip his lord, and with the good-will of Adam of Berkeswelle and Agnes his wife, mother of the grantor, releases to Peter, prior of D., in free alms, a certain part of his ditch in D. between his curtilage and the court of the said prior, &c., viz. from the court of John Neel which John Wyleys used to hold to the angle of my curtilage by my croft, in order that they may make a wall there. Witnesses: Simon de aula in D., Geoffrey de aula of the same, Robert Waleys, Robert le Werrour, Thomas le Barkere. 1289–c. 1300.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 31 The counterpart to D. 30. [Fragmentary.] Pointed oval seal, 1¼″ × ⅞″, in green wax: a fish, like a sword-fish, swimming, with a star and crescent above. AMOR · VINCIT · OMNIA.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 32 The same to the same, granting a wall behind the monks’ ‘vivaria’ and giving them licence to enclose a road extending from the high road to their hospital. Witnesses: Sir Walter fitz-Robert lord of D., John fitz-Philip of the same, William le porter, Robert le Werrour, William ——. [Torn.] 1291–1318.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 33 Walter fitz-Robert lord of D. quit-claims to D., &c., his right in a wall behind their ‘vivaria’ in D. It extends from his ‘cultura’ behind his ‘vivaria’ to the house which a certain Bertram once held from the monks in the same vill in le Netherend. The monks may also enclose a certain road in D. between their granges and their garden, extending from the high-road to their Hospital. Witnesses: John fitz-Philip of D., Simon de aula of the same, Richard le Warde of the same, Robert Waleys, John Godchep, William the porter, Robert le Werrour. c. 1310–20.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 192 John Horn of D., chaplain, grants to John the wheelwright for a certain sum of money the whole of his tenement, with houses, buildings, curtilages, &c., in D. in le Netherende between the tenement which Geoffrey Burnbel held in villainage and a certain portion of land which the grantor gave to Matilda daughter of Richard le Webbe. Given at D. Witnesses: John Scop, Simon Baudewyne, Simon de aula, John le draper, Thomas de pistrino in D. 12 Aug. 1313.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 202 Adam de Brochole, chaplain, John de pistrino of D. and Richard Gunnyls of Staverton, chaplain, quit-claim to Robert Bateman of D. and Matilda his wife, their right in a house with curtilage adjoining in D. in le Netherende, between John le Wheelwrihte’s land and that of the monks: 24 feet in breadth, and in length reaching from the high-road to the monks’ wall, which the said R. B. and M. had by the gift of John le Weelwrihte. Witnesses: Robert Simond, William de aula, Thomas Baudewyne, Symon de Neubolde, William de Staverton of D. 13 April 1340.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 201 John Herberd, wheelwright, of D. grants to Nicholas Herberd of Throp, a tenement in D. which the said John held of Isabella, the lady of D., for his life. Rent: 12d. Given at D. Witnesses:… Robert Symond, William de aula, John le draper of D. [Almost illegible.] 9 Feb. 1341.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 34 Richard Gunnold of Staverton, chaplain, quit-claims to Nicholas Harberd of Throp all his right in——by the messuage of William Canon towards the west and in two cottages with curtilages and in 8d. rent from the cottage of Robert Maunsel by the said cottages. Given at D. Witnesses: Robert Symond, William de aula of Staverton, Simon de Neubolde, John le draper of D. 16 Feb. 1341

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 63a Adam de Brochole, chaplain, quit-claims to Nicholas Herberd of Throp all his right in (i) a messuage and curtilage in D. in le Netherende by the messuage of William Cannoun towards the west; (ii) two cottages and curtilages by the same messuage of William Cannoun, towards the east; (iii) 8d. rent from Robert Maunsel’s cottage, by the said cottages. Given at D. Witnesses: Robert Simon, William de aula, Simon de Neubolde, William of Staverton, John le draper of D. 16 Feb. 1341.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 203 Alice, widow of John Herberd, wheelwright of D., quit-claims to Nicholas Herberd of Throp, all her right in that tenement in le Netherende (extending from the high-road to Robert Bateman’s land) which the said Nicholas gave to John her husband. Given at D. Witnesses: William de Staverton, William West, senior, William de …, John Snef, William West, junior, of D. 25 June 1344.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 204 Simon son of Robert Fissher of D. grants to Richard de Neubolde of D. one acre and one rood of meadow in D., viz. in Tounslade. Rent for the first 10 years—a rose at Midsummer, if demanded, and after that term 5/-. Given at London. Witnesses: John de Bernghby, William de Braundeston, John de N[ewen]han, John Osbarne, John West of D. 15 Feb. 1355.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 205 Simon son of Robert le Fisshere of D. grants to Richard de Neubolde of D. 2 acres of arable land, viz. 5 strips lying together above Middelforlong and one strip reaching to the Welton road, and one piece of pasture called le Sidgras, with the reversion of 1 acre and 1 rood of meadow in Touslade, ‘cum accideret in campo de D.’. Witnesses: William del Bakhous, William Baudewyne, John West, Roger del Halle, John Dyllyng. Given at D. 17 July 1355.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 71 Richard of Neubolde of D., clerk, appoints John of Neubolde of D. his attorney to receive seisin of lands, rents, &c., late of Nicholas Herberd in D. Given at London. 12 July 1358.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 208 Thomas fitz-Walter lord of D. quit-claims to D. all his right in certain tenements and rents in D. and Drayton. [Mutilated and partly effaced.] 29 Sept. 1366.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 73b Thomas fitz-Walter grants privileges in his manor to D. [Fragmentary.] 21 Dec. 1377.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 35 Thomas Fitz-Waut’, kt., lord of D., quit-claims to William, prior of D., &c., all his right in the tenements late of Nicholas Herberd, and Richard Newbolde, in le Netherhende and in the tenement late of William Ruynysch which messuage John
Wyluby now holds in D. Given at D. Witnesses: John Waundel, Robert Westone, Robert Barker, John Bernarde, John Saunders. 24 Dec. 1377. Circular seal, 1″, in red wax: SIGILLUM THOME … WAUT’. The fitz-Walter arms: a fess between two chevrons.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 72 Charter by which Thomas (fitz-Walter) grants to D. certain lands and services of lands and tenants in D. and Drayton. Witnesses: William Thornyng, William Peresey, … John Blache, John Wandel, John …, Herbert (?) Westone, John Dyllyng of D. [Fragmentary.] 19 Dec. 1377.

body.note:
Daventry and Drayton.
The Symond Holding.

div.p: MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 37 Philip de Opthrop of D. grants to Matilda his daughter 3 half-acres of land in D., viz. in the south field ½ acre above Waltforlong by the land of Hylewyse super montem; in the north field ½ acre at le Russebeddes by the land of Helewyse and ½ acre with headrigs, at Baneslade by the said H’s land. Given at D. Witnesses: Geoffrey Gamel, John Blaunfront of Drayton, Geoffrey de aula, Nicholas Celle, Thomas Nicholas, Thomas le Barkere, Robert Baudewyne of D. 13 April 1309.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 36 John Neel of D. gives to Robert Symond of D. and Henry his son 9½ acres of arable land in Drayton, viz. in the Southern field 5 roods together over Mawelonde by the land of Geoffrey le Porter; 5 roods lying together over Westbrocforlong by the land of Geoffrey Gamel; ½ acre over Northlongforlong by the land late of Lucas de Baddeby: In the North field 5 roods lying together over Waltforlong by the land of the lord which John son of Ralph once held in villeinage; 5 roods lying together in the same shot by the land of Helewise super Montem; 5 roods lying together over Tunstale by the land of Simon de Potkote; 5 roods ‘into’ Oldegore by the land of Optrhop; ½ acre abutting on Gosecroft by the land of Symon of Potkote; 1 acre abutting on Gosecroft by the land of Symon son of Sir John of Daventry on the one part and the land late of Henry Carpenter of Drayton on the other. Witnesses: John Scop, Nicholas Celle, Geoffrey de aula, John Cuth, Robert Baudewyne of D. Given at D. 25 April 1314. Circular seal, 3″, in black wax: legend illegible; a bird like an ostrich.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 38 John Neel of D. quit-claims to Robert Symon of the same and Henry his son. Witnesses: Simon Baudewyne of D., Geoffrey de aula of the same, William de pistrino of the same, Simon de aula of the same, John Scop of the same, Nicholas Celle of the same, John the cook of the same. Given at D. 21 Sept. 1320.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 37 William son of Sir John of D., kt., grants to Henry son of Robert Symond of D. 1 acre of arable land in Drayton viz., in the North field half an acre over Langedone by the land of William Gymme, and in the South field half an acre under Stepenhul by the land of the said William. Witnesses: Robert Willymet of D., Robert Symond of the same, William de aula, John le Werrour of Drayton, Geoffrey le porter of the same. Given at D. 4 April 1342. Seal.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 38 William son of Robert Gymme of Drayton grants to Matilda wife of Robert Symond of D. and Matilda her daughter three half-acres of arable land in Drayton, viz. in the South field, ½ acre over Mereforlong by the land of John of M——, 1 rood over Olnesbrech by the land of the said Matilda. In the North field ½ acre over Ryelondesmor, ½ acre over Fichelesthorn; from Michaelmas 17 E. III. for 8 years. Also 5 roods of arable lying under Cleypitteshul by the land of Jordan Philip. Witnesses: Robert Wyllymet, William de aula, Jordan Scon, William Baudewyne, John de aula of D. Mich. 1343.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 39 Indenture by which John Saloman of Drayton grants to Matilda wife of Robert Symond of D. and Matilda their daughter, one acre 2 roods of arable land in the South field of Drayton, viz. one acre lying together at ‘le Crosweye’ over ’le Brodebottes’ by the said Matilda’s land, one rood under Stepenhul by the said Matilda’s land, one rood into Westegrovesithe by the lord of D.’s land, from Michaelmas 17 Ed. III. for 12 years. [Rent not given.] Witnesses: Robert Wylymet of D., William de aula of the same, John Werrour of Drayton. 29 Sept. 1343.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 40 William son of Robert Gymme of Drayton grants to Henry son of Robert Symond of D. 5 acres of arable land and meadow with the adjacent headrigs in the fields of Drayton, viz. in the North
field 5 roods lying with the headrigs beneath le Cleypittes by the land of Jordan of Opthrop; 5 roods with the headrigs lying over le Longebuche by the land of the said Jordan; 3 roods with headrigs in Cleuerslade by the land of the said Jordan: 3 roods of meadow lying in le Smethemede by the meadow of John le Werrour; ½ acre with headrigs beneath Stonhul by the land of Thomas le spicer; 1 piece of meadow at Stonhulsitheoverende by the meadow of Simon of D. by the South field; ½ acre beneath Othul by the grantor’s land. Witnesses: John de pistrino of D., Robert Symond of the same, William de aula of the same. John le Werrour of Drayton, Geoffrey le porter of the same. Given at D. 25 April 1345.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 41 William son of lord John of D. grants to Robert Symond of D. and Henry his son a 2/- rent from 3 acres of land which John the wheelwright of D. and Alice his wife held from the grantor for the term of their lives, with reversion after their death; viz. 1 acre in the south field of D. over D. Maweland by the land of Richard le Webbe, ½ acre over le Loch extending into Southeok by the land of Symon of Neubolde, 1 rood beneath le Lyde between the land of the lord of D. on the one hand and land of Robert of D. on the other. In the south field of Drayton 5 roods lying beneath Stepenhul between the land late of John Bayuel and Robert le Barkere. Witnesses: John de pistrino of D., William de aula of the same, Jordan Scon of the same, Robert Smith of the same, Symon Gymma of the same. Given at D. 22 Jan. 1346. Seal.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 42 Alice late the wife of John Herberd, wheelwright of D., quit-claims to Robert Symond of D. and Henry his son her right in 3 acres of arable land in D. and Drayton. [Bounds as in D. 41.] Given at D. Witnesses: John Bachous, William of Staverton, Simon Baudewyne, William West, junior, William de Lauda of D. 18 Oct. 1346.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 43 William of D. son of the late John of D., kt., grants to Robert Simond of D. and Henry his son 4 acres of arable land in D. and Drayton, viz. in the south field of D. 1 acre lying together in D. Mawelond by the land late of John le whelwryghte; ½ acre at le Clerkespath by the land of Simon of Neubolde; 1 rood by le Park Weye by the land of John of D. In the south field 01 Drayton
5 roods under Stepenhulle by the land of Geoffrey le porter of Drayton; ½ acre at le Grouesithe under le Lede by the land of William Gemme, and in the north field of Drayton ½ acre over Langedone by the land of the same William Gemme. Given at D. Witnesses: John Bachous, William de aula, William de Lauda of D., Geoffrey le porter, John le Wereur of Drayton. 12 Nov. 1348.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 44 John le Bakere of D. and Matilda his wife grant to Henry son of Robert Symond of D. 1 rood of arable land in the south field of Drayton beyond the high-road leading towards Staverton by the land of John le Werrour. Witnesses: Robert Symond, William ate Halle, John le Werrour, Thomas le Wyte, William Adam. Given at Drayton. 9 Dec. 1348.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 170b William of D. son of the late Sir John of D., kt., quit-claims to Robert Simond of D. and Henry his son, all his right in 4 acres of arable land in D. and Drayton. [Bounds as in D. 43.] 10 Dec. 1348.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 69 Robert Simond of D. grants to William le Werreur of Drayton, chaplain, all his goods and chattels in the lands in D. and Drayton which the said William has by his gift. Witnesses: William de Lauda, Robert Godchep, … Robert de Brochole, Richard le Taillour of D. 14 May 1349.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 45 Indenture by which Henry son of Robert Symond of D. gives to Margery late the wife of Robert Neel of D. 1½ acres 1 rood situated thus:—½ ac. in the southern field above the Lok by the land of Simon Newbolde: ½ ac. in the western field under the Lyche by the land of Thomas Spicer: ½ acre in the northern field over Langden by the land of Walter le Meleward: and a rood in Radmondeslond by the land of John le Werrour. Witnesses: Geoffrey le porter of Drayton, Richard Goodchere, William Baudewyne, John Baudewine, William Adam. Given at D. 2 July 1349.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 46 Robert Simond of D. grants to William le Werrour of Drayton by D. chaplain two messuages in D. with curtilages adjacent. [Boundaries illegible.] Witnesses: William de Lauda, Robert Godchep, Jordan le Sw …, John de Brochole, Richard le Taillour of D. [Torn.] 14 March 1350.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 47 Matilda, widow of Robert Symond of D., grants to John her son 2½ acres of arable land in D. viz. an acre in the northern field lying over le Low by the land late of Robert of D., Kt., ½ acre of forest over Goldenhulle of the land of John Neubolde; 1 acre in the southern field, lying in Wetlonde by the land late of William of Stavertone. Given at D. Witnesses: John Neubolde, William Baudewyne, William Bachous, John Saundres, John West of D. 1 May 1357.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 48 John Neel and the prior &c. of D. agree that the tithes of crops from a croft called Gemmeser shall be commuted for a rent of 1d. Witnesses: Sir Robert Fitz-Walter lord of D., William of Bradden, kts., Thomas of Boltisham, John of Craunford, John Abbe of Staverton, William West of the same, William of Drayton in D., Robert Werrour of the same. [Torn.] 13 Ed. I. Seal, as in D. 49.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 49 John Neel grants to D. in free-alms 1½ acres of land in D., lying over Fischwerehul between the prior’s land and the Daventry-Norton road. In exchange they have given him a croft called Millewardis croft in D. by the Walton road on the west. They also release to him their right in 5 strips at the head of D. towards Drayton, by the high road to Leicester on the north. Witnesses: Sir Robert fitz-Walter lord of D., John fitz-Philip, William of Drayton, Robert le Werrour, Robert Gemme, Simon de aula, William de Campedene. 15 Ed. I. Circular seal, 3″, in green wax: a spreading tree (?) with two birds upon it: S’ JOH’IS DE DAVINTRIE.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 50 John Neel grants to D. in free-alms ½ acre of land in D., lying over Suthbrok under Hauton hill between the prior’s land on the west and the land late of William Randolf on the east. In exchange John receives two roods of arable land under Ryehill between his own land on the west and that of Simon le Champiun on the east. Witnesses: Sir Robert Fitz-Walter lord of D., John
fitz Philip, Master William of Drayton, Baldwin le Champiun, Thomas de pistrino, Robert le Werrour, Simon de aula. 29 Sept. 1287. Seal, as in D. 49.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. i Since master William de Poncii once held from D. a tenement ‘in magna placea’ on the north side, between the tenement of John son of Philip (which William Waleys holds from him) on the east, and the tenement of Baldewyn Paunsel on the west (held from D.) for 10/- a year; and afterwards the said master William granted the said tenement to William Campedene and his heirs for his homage and service and 4/- rent; and D. brought this homage, service and rent from Robert Fox, heir of the said master William; the prior, &c. have now assigned it to the Chapel of S. Mary. Given in the monastery. Feb. 2 1283.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xvii Robert son of William Fox of D. grants to D. and the chapel of S. Mary in free-alms, the homage and service of Robert Way of D., for ½ an acre over Langedone, which he held from the granter. Rent: 1d. Witnesses: Walter of Wulwardyngtone, John Bayuel, Thomas de Gaunt, Baldewyne le champion, John son of the smith, Richard Scop, Henry de Rokeby. Before 1288.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xix Mariota Schep, widow of Gilbert Schep in D., grants to Geoffrey aula and Felicia his wife half an acre of land in the east field of D., reaching to the Dodeforde road, by the land of Henry Godebolde. Rent:½d. Given at D. Witnesses: John fitz-Philip of D., Thomas de pistrino, Simon de aula, John Schep, master William of Drayton , clerk. 6 May 1295.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xviii Geoffrey de aula of D. and Felicia his wife grant to John Cokeney of D. and Agnes his wife [the same half-acre]. Rent: ½d. Witnesses: [the same, &] John Godchep. 15 Aug. 1298.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 34 John fitz-Philip de D. grants to Walter de Buckeby of D. 2/- rent in D. from Simon de aula, from the tenement which Walter holds from Simon in D. Given at D. Witnesses: William de Drayton, Thomas de pistrino, Geoffrey de aula, Robert Walies, John Scoph, Thomas …, Roger Cuth. 21 Dec. 1300.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 190 Robert son of Sir John fitz-Philip of D., confirms a grant which Walter de Buckeby brought from Sir John, his father, of 2/- rent from the said Walter’s tenement in D. Given at D. Witnesses: William of Draitone, Simon Baudewyne, Geoffrey de aula, Thomas de pistrino, Robert le Wodeward of D. [Mutilated.] 31 July 1306.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xvi Elyas de Launda and Emma his wife grant to D. and the chapel of S. Mary in free alms 4d. rent for 4 years. Witnesses: John fitz-Philip of D., John Neel of the same, William de Draytone of the same, Simon de aula of the same, Thomas de pistrino of the same. [Marginal note: ‘quondam Willelmus Kent solvit.’] c. 1300–1320.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 39 Thomas de Falls, of D. is bound to John Neel of the same, to deliver to him or to his attorney a certain feoffment which he caused to be made of 2/- rent in D, before Michaelmas 6 Ed. II, or to repay 20/4. Given at D. 18 June 1312.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 51 Thomas le Eyr of Falewesle grants to D. in free-alms 5 acres 1 rood in D., which he bought from John Neel viz. 1 acre in the east field by the land of John de pistrino abutting into Thropwye: 1½ acres in the north field, by the land of Simon Baudewyne, and 1½ acres in the same by the land of Simon Neuwebolde: one acre in the same over Foxholes ‘siue Chonic” [? = conigeram, a warren] by the land of the prior: — rood in the same shot by the prior’s land. Witnesses: Sir John of D., Simon de aula, Geoffrey de aula, S[imon] [Bau]dewyne of D., John le Werrour. [Torn.] c. 1300–1320.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 52 & 52a Eustace of Burneby in Watforde grants to Peter, prior of D. &c. 7½ acres meadow in D. called Thredhygodes, in free alms. They lie between the prior’s meadow on the north and Sir John of D.’s meadow on the south. Witnesses: John of Tuwe of Welton, Henry le Eyr (or Heyr) of the same, William le Freynche of Staverton, Nicholas le Ro of the same, Simon de aula of D., Geoffrey de aula of the same, John le Werrour of Drayton. Given at D. 16 Sept. 1317. & 11 Nov. 1318. [There are two copies of this deed.]

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 53 Eustace de Borneby in Watford quit-claims to D. all his right in 7½ acres of meadow in D. called Thritchygodes, lying between
the prior’s meadow on the north and Sir John of D.’s meadow on the south. Given at D. Witnesses, John de Tuwe of Welton, Henry le Heyr of the same, William le Freynsche of Staverton, Nicholas le Ro of the same, Simon de aula of D., Geoffrey de aula of the same, John le Werrour of Drayton. 2 Feb. 1319.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 54 Joan daughter of Robert de Heyerington in D, grants to D. and the almoner, half an acre of land above a shot called Olnesbrech, by the land of Adam de Bernby towards the west, and the land late of Simon de Morkote towards the east. Given at D. Witnesses: Robert West of Staverton, Nicholas le Ro of the same, John Scop of D., Geoffrey de aula of the same, William de aula of the same, Michael of Northam of the same, Geoffrey of Drayton. 20 July 1322.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 197 Joan daughter of Robert de Heyeringtone of D., quit-claims to D., her right in one acre of land on a shot called Olnesbrech. Given at D. Witnesses: Robert West of [Sta]verton, Nicholas le Ro of the same, John Scop of D., Geoffrey de aula of the same, Simon de aula of the same, Michael de Norton of the same, Geoffrey Gamel of Draytone. 1 Aug. 1323.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 54 John Cook and Christiana his wife grant to D. and the Almoner, half an acre and one rood of land in the west field of D., between the lord of D.’s land and that of the prior. Witnesses: [], Geoffrey le porter, John le Werrour of Drayton, Geoffrey le porter [sic.] [Tom.] 1 Aug. 1323.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 55 The quit-claim for D. 54. Witnesses: Geoffrey de aula of D., William de aula of the same, John Scop of the same, John le Werrour of Drayton, Geoffrey le porter of the same, Geoffrey Gamel of the same, William Adam of the same. 15 Aug. 1323.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 200 William de … grants to Roger his son, (i) a house in D., lying between John Snou’s tenement and the road leading to Sir Robert of Daventry’scourt; (ii) … shillings 4 pence rent in D. i.e. 2/- from … and 6d. from the tenement which Robert of Sprotton held, (iii) 2 acres of arable land, in the north field of D. (iv) ½ acre at Suthbrocbrigge, by Thomas Baudewyne’s land, in the south field of D. (v) ½ acre above Badde … in the south field of Drayton. Given at D. Witnesses: Robert Symond, John de pistrino,
William de pistrino, Simon de Neubolde, Robert Baudewyne, Thomas Baudewyne, … Baudewyne of D. [Mutilated.] 10 Dec. 1336.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 198 William … of Olthorpe quit-claims to Edmund Newenham of Shuttesbury and William … right in certain land in D. … April 1346. [Mutilated.] (See 63b.]

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 231 William Yonge, vicar of D., grants to Roger Newenham of D., ½ acre of arable land in the north field of Drayton, in Ayreslade, the land of Robert Godechep, which W. Y. had by the gift of John Gymelin. Witnesses: John Waundel, John, … Edmund Porter … … after 7 July 1360.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 207 Agnes late the wife of Thomas Robard of D., grants to Adam … and Symon Baudewyne of the same, two messuages in D. by the messuage of John … and one Thoron aker in D. at les Wyndmulnes. Given at D. Witnesses: Roger atte Halle, John Saundres, John Willyn … 4 Aug. 1361.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 188 John son of John the butcher of D., grants to Simon de aula 2/- rent from a messuage which John Fers holds in D. Given at D. Witnesses: William de …, Thomas de pistrino, Thomas le Barker, John Godechep, John Gigel [sic]. 6 Dec. 1293.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 187 John son and heir of John Neel of D., quit-claims to Richard the Tailor 3/- rent in D. [Mutilated.] c. 1300.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 46 Richard the tailor of D. grants to D. in free-alms a rent of 3/- from a gate in Bayueleslane between Richard de Norton’s tenement and that of John de Welton, 8 feet in width; and from a certain curtilege lying between Robert le Barkere and John de Welton, which gate messuage and curtilege John West once held from the grantor, who had bought them from John Neel at the stated rent. Witnesses: Simon Baudewyne of D., Geoffrey de aula of the same, Simon de aula of the same, Geoffrey Gamel of Drayton, John le Werrour of the same. Given at D. 29 Sept. 1317.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 196 Richard Hemery dwelling in Buckeby, grants to Richard the tailor 4/- rent in D. from the tenement which Robert Horn held, lying between the messuages of John Godchep and Richard of Nortone. Given at D. Witnesses: Simon Baudewyne, John Scopp, Simon de aula, Geoffrey de aula, Simon de Neubolde of D., John le Werrour, Geoffrey Gamel of Drayton. 3 May 1319.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 195 Richard the tailor of D., by an indenture, grants to the prior, &c. of D. for 40 years the same rent. Witnesses: Simon de aula of D., Geoffrey de aula, Thomas Baudewyne, William de aula, Thomas de Falwesle, John le Werreour of Draytone, Geoffrey Gamel. 6 May 1319.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 48 The same grants to Peter, prior, &c., of D. the same rent. Given at D. Witnesses: Simon Baudewyne of D., John Scop of the same, Symon de aula, Geoffrey de aula, Simon de Neubolde of D., John le Werrour, Geoffrey Gamel of Drayton. 29 June 1319.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 56 The same quit-claims the same to the same. Same witnesses. 1 Aug. 1320.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 56a John Neel son and heir of the late John Neel of D. quit-claims to Richard the tailor, for a certain sum of money, his right in 6 shillings rent from a messuage in D. Given at D. Witnesses: Simon Baudewyne, Simon de aula, Geoffrey de aula, John le draper of Daventry. [Mutilated.] 1319.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 57 Richard the tailor of D. quit-claims to D. his right in 6/- rent in D. from a messuage which John Cuth held from him, situated between the land of Richard Floge and that of John Pake, with all homages, &c. Given at D. Witnesses: Sir John fitz-Philip, kt. of D., Symon Baudewyne of the same, Symon de aula of the same, Robert Symond of the same, Geoffrey de aula of the same, John le draper of the same, John Schop of the same, John le Werrour of Drayton, Geoffrey Gamel of the same. 29 Aug. 1319.

div.head:
The Tailor tenement in Longemershe.
D. 58–62.

div.p:
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. viii John son and heir of John Neel of D. grants to Richard the tailor half an acre of arable land in the south field of D., in the
Longemershe, between the land of Simon of Skerewyth and that of Simon Baudewyne. Witnesses: Simon Baudewyne, Simon de aula, William de pistrino, Geoffrey de la sale, John le drapere of D. 26 Mar. 1318.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. ix Power of attorney from John Neel to John Packe (alias John of Welton) to deliver seisin of the same to D. Witnesses: [the same, except that ‘Geoffrey de la sale’ is called ‘Geoffrey de aula’]. Same date.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 58 John Neel late son and heir of John Neel of D. grants to Richard the tailor of D. for a certain sum of money, 3 half acres of arable land lying together in the Longemerch in D. between the prior’s land and that of Simon Baudewyne. Given at D. Witnesses: Simon Baudewyne of D., Symon de aula of the same, Geoffrey de aula of the same, John Bachous of the same, Robert Simond of the same, Simon Neubold of the same, John le drapere of the same. 3 Feb. 1320. [D. 6, no. x is a transcript.]

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 59 The same to the same, another ½ acre in L. Given at D. Witnesses: Simon Baudewyne of D., Simon de aula of the same, Geoffrey de aula of the same, John Bakhous of the same, Simon Neubolde of the same, John Draper of the same, John Werrour of Drayton, Geoffrey Gamel of the same. 14 Feb. 1320. Circular seal, 1¼″, in brown wax: an open pair of scissors. [D. 6, no. 1 is a transcript.]
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. li Adam son of Henry of Bradwell confirms the above.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 60 Richard the tailor of D. grants to D. and the chapel of S. Mary, for the soul of brother Peter of Twyford, ½ an acre of arable land in the Longemersh, between the land of Simon Baudewyne and that late of John Neel. Given at D. Witnesses: Simon Baudewyne of D., Simon de aula of D., Geoffrey de aula of D., Robert Baudewene of D., William de aula of D., Symon de Neubolde of D., John le drapere of D. 22 Feb. 1320. [D. 6, no. xiii is a transcript.]

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 61 Richard the tailor of D. grants to Peter, prior, &c., of D. 1 acre of land in the Longemersch by the ½ acre which he had already
granted. Given at D. Witnesses: Symon Baudewyne of D., Symon de aula of the same, Geoffrey de aula of the same, John de pistrino of the same, Robert Symon of the same, Symon de Neubold of the same, John le drapere of the same. 12 March 1320. [D. 6, no. xi is a transcript.]

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xii John Neel quit-claims to R. the tailor, for a certain sum of money, the said three half acres, which Simon de Skyrwith once held from him. Witnesses: Simon Baudewyne, Simon de aula, Geoffrey de aula, Simon de Newebolde, John le drapere of D. 12 March 1320.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 62 Richard the tailor of D. grants to Peter, prior of D., &c., and the chapel of the Blessed Mary ½ acre of arable land in the south field of D. in the Longemersh between the land of Simon of Skerewyth and Robert Baudewyne. Given at D. Witnesses: Simon de Neubolde, William de pistrino, Geoffrey de aula, William de aula of D. 2 Feb. 1322. [D. 6, no. vii is a transcript.]

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 57 Geoffrey Janitor dwelling in Drayton by D. [grants to] Richard the tailor of D. 4 strips of land in D., lying together between the lord of D.’s land and that of Agnes Martin. Witnesses: Geoffrey de aula of D., Geoffrey le porter of the same, Robert Baudewyne of the same, William de aula of the same, John le Werrour of Drayton, Geoffrey Gamul of the same, William Adam of the same. Given at D. 25 Dec. 1327.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 199 Richard le Taylor of D. grants to D. 2/6 rent from the tenement late of William West; 6/- rent from a tenement late of John Ent, and 8/- rent from a tenement late of Geoffrey Gamel. Given at D. 25 April 1330.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 67 Roger son of William ate Halle of D. grants to Thomas … and Alice his wife two messuages with curtilages in D. Rent [illegible]. Witnesses: … William Baudewyne, John Saunders, Simon le Bakere, Richard Baiuel and Alice. Given at … 25 March 1346.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 206 John Waundel of D. quit-claims to Roger of the Halle right in those tenements in D. and Neweland, between John Spicer’s land and that of John War … viz. 7½ acres 1 rood which the said J. W. and R. of the H. held of the gift of William Smyth. Given at D. Witnesses: William Bachous, William Baudewyne, … John Saunders, John Symond of D. 7 March 1359.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 209 Fragment of an indenture by which Sarah, widow of … Halle of D., grants to Thomas … between the messuage of William Mulward and that of John Har …, for 4 years. Rent: 12/-. Given at D. Witnesses: John Waundel, William … 45 Ed. III.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 86a William Mullward of D., and John Faukener of Byfelde grants to Richard Halle of D. and Elizabeth his wife the land in D. and Drayton which the grantors had of the feoffment of the said Richard. Given at D. Witnesses: Robert Barkere, Simon Stavertone, John Werreur, Simon Horn, John Heywode, John West, Roger Iremonger. 6 Oct. 1389.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 212 Indenture by which Richard Hall of D. leases to John Sadeler and Agnes his wife, for their lives, a messuage with curtilage adjoining in D., in le Newlond. Rent: 8/-. Given at D. Witnesses: Hugh Cleydon, … de Willescote, Thomas …, John Dillyng. 29 Sept. 1419. Endorsed with entry about Thomas Halle son of Richard Halle 21 Hen. VI.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 217 Nicholas West of D. quit-claims to Thomas Halle his right in two cottages in D. in le Pyle … between John Yronmonger’s cottage and that of T. H., which cottages he has by the charter of N. W. Given at D. Witnesses: Thomas Tuwe , esq., John Staverton, Thomas Marche, Richard Pereson’, John Yronmonger. 1 May 1439.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 104a Thomas Halle of D. demises to William Boteler of the same and Isabella his wife a plot in D., for their lives, near the holding of John Staverton on the one side and the Runbylons high road on the other, from Michaelmas next. Rent: 7/- and a little pig.
Witnesses: John Iremonger, William Mason, Richard Wedewerd, Richard Peresone, Nicholas Hosyer. 29 July 1443.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 63 Thomas Halle of D. grants to Nicholas Vaus, kt., John Tresham , esq., and Thomas Stafford , esq., all his possessions in D. and Drayton and in Newnam by D. which he had after the death of Thomas Halle his father. Witnesses: William de Staverton of Daventry. Thomas Graunt of the same, Thomas Wyloughby of the same, Thomas [] of the same, and Richard Balles. 4 March 1486. Seal.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 23b JohnTresham, Thomas Stafford, and Thomas Halle, grant to Thomas Emson , esq., John Dey , clerk, John Chauncy, Robert Chauntrell, and Robert Skypton, all their lands in Newenham, Daventre, and Drayton. To hold the same for the uses declared in the last will of the said Thomas Halle. 20 Oct. 1507.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 72 Henry the Cook grants to D., &c., in free alms 4½ acres of land in Drayton which he bought from William Gemme, viz. 2 acres in the field of Norton under the hill by the Welton road; ½ acre beyond Cleiputtis; ½ acre under the hill towards the Welton road; ½ acre on the hill towards Brantemeweie; 1 rood in Tarlbredafu[rlong]; ½ acre in the south field under Stepenhul; ½ acre in Mawalonde; ½ acre over Mersfurlong and 1 rood at Broderusses. Rent: 2d. at Easter. He also confirms two messuages. Witnesses: Simon de Trop, William of D., William Nigelli (sic), John Baiuel, William Plumstone, Robert Werur. 1250–59.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 8 Nicholas, prior, &c., of D. grants to Richard de Boudon , clerk, a messuage in … Witnesses: Sir Robert fitz-Walter, Sir …, Ph …bi, John de Neubolde. c. 1254–64.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 22 Richard de Bo[udon] grants to D. scattered half acres in … Witnesses: William Gulafre of Norton, John de Braunfeld, William Plumstone, William West, Geoffrey le porter of D., William Evermu … d, John Abbe, John Gunnild. 1260–80.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 27a List of services and rents, for lands in Drayton and Staverton, of some tenants of D., contained in Richard de Boudon’s charter. from Simon fitz-Philip of Drayton 3 roods for homage, c. 1260–70. ” the same and Mary Coynterel 3 half-acres for homage and service and 1d. ” William fitz-Simon 1 acre for homage and service and two roses. ” Thomas scriptor of Drayton 2 roods for service and one rose. ” William Gemme and Heleuise his daughter ½ acre, for one flower. ” ” ” one acre for homage and service and one rose. ” ” ” one rood for homage and service and one rose. ” ” ” 2½ acres one rood for homage and service and 1d. ” Richard rufus of Staverton 1 acre for homage and service and one clove gillyflower. ” Gilbert le Graunt 1 acre for homage and service and ½d.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 73 Robert lord of Tinggrith, son of Sir Walter of D., quit-claims to Peter, prior, &c., of D. and the almoner his right in 2 acres of land which Richard the tailor of D. gave to the said almoner in free alms: 5 roods lie together over Mixene forlong by the land of Geoffrey Gamel and 1 rood over Teneacres in Drayton: ½ acre in the west field of D., by the grantor’s windmill. Witnesses: John of Branfeld of Trop by D., John his son, John le Werreur of Draytone by D., Geoffrey Gamel of the same, Geoffrey le porter of the same, Thomas Baudewine of D., Geoffrey de aula of the same, Simon of Neubolde of the same, Geoffrey le porter of D. 1289–1291. Small circular seal, 7/10″, in red wax: a shield of arms, 2 chevrons, S’ ROB’TI FILI’ WALTERI.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 74 John Cuth of D. grants to … of D. ½ an acre of land lying in …re Forlong by Simon Baudewyn’s land. [Fragmentary.] July 1325Only the ’d’ of the ‘decimo’ remains.–July 1326.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 75 John Cuth of D. grants to Richard the tailor (i) ‘totam forestam que jacet pro dimidea acra terre’ in the east field of D. over
Brerforlong by Simon de Neubold’s land; (ii) a rood of land in the north field of D. Witnesses: Geoffrey de aula of (D?), Robert Baudewyn, Simon de aula of the same, John Werreour of Drayton, Geoffrey Gamel of the same, Geoffrey le porter, John de Welton of the same, William the carpenter. Given at D. [Fragmentary.] 16 Feb. 1326.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 76 John Cyth of D. quit-claims to Robert … his right in an acre of land in the north field of Drayton. Given at D. Witnesses: Simon of D., William ad aulam, Laurence Symond, Thomas de Waltone, Adam de Mortome, John ad … [Torn.] 23 July 1346.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 216 Robert, prior, &c., of D. leases to John Willoughby, Agnes his wife and Thomas their son, and their assigns, a messuage and garden in D., formerly belonging to William Rynys, lying between the messuage of J. W. on the east, and that of Richard Scotor on the west, reaching from the road to John Staverton’s land. For 90 years. Rent: 10/-. Given at D. Witnesses: John Barker, Thomas Halle, Richard[?] Fischer, William Mason, Richard Graunt. 18 Mar. 1432.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 219 Simon Stareton alias Simon Scope of D., glover, and Isabella his wife, demise to John Stareton of Scope, cooper, and Isabella his wife, for their lives, a messuage and croft in D., between William Pryle’s tenement and that of Thomas Halle. Rent: a rose at Midsummer, if it is claimed. 7 Oct. 1460.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 211 William Newenham , esq., of … ford, Henry Michell , gent., of Dodford, and Henry Smyth of West Haddon, yeoman, demise to Thomas Arnold of D., and Alice his wife, a messuage in D. in Hogges markett, and they appoint Edmund Hays their attorney to deliver seisin. Given at D. Witnesses: William Staverton , gent., Thomas Lou …, Thomas Graunt, John Knype, Simon …, John Scop of D. 12 Nov. 1484.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 64 John Scot son and heir of Richard Scot of D., bocher, and Eleanor his wife quit-claim to Thomas Arnold of D. and Alice his wife all their right in a messuage in D. in the Hoggesmarkett by the messuage of Roger Hauberk, and that of John Scot to the east, and extending to the highroad. Given at D. Witnesses: William Staverton, gentleman, Thomas Lewys, Thomas Graunt, John Knype of D. [Torn.] 8 May 1485.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 65 Thomas Ustone prior, &c., of D. grant to William Fynall, king’s sergeant an annual pension of 26/8 in the name of the king’s corrody (no witnesses). Given in the chapter house. 13 Jan. 1502.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 84 William Wright of D. and William …, quit-claims to John Werrour of D. all their right in the lands which they had of the gift of … Witnesses: John Heywode, Simon … and others of D. Given at D. Friday after St. M … 1 Hen. VI?.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 66 John Werrour of D. grants to John Brown of Norton, senior, and John Brown of Norton, junior, 22 acres 1 rood in D. and Drayton, 11 acres late of William Gym, and 10 roods of meadow in D., which were formerly held by the said J. B. senior; also 5 roods of meadow late of Edward Porter, and 12d. of rent in Throp by D. from the tenement which Richard Falclyff holds. Witnesses: John Heywode, John Barker, John Wylughby, William Wryght and Simon Heyn, junior and others of D. Given at D. 29 July 1413.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 66a Power of attorney to William Brown of N. to deliver seisin of the above. Same witnesses.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 67 William Catesby , esq., of Asshebyelygger, William Lane of Oslyngbery, gentleman, William Staverton of D. gentleman, to William Lane, prior, &c., of D. their right in 3 half acres of arable land and a rood of meadow in D. which the grantors had jointly of the gift of William Holte of D., yeoman and Joan his wife, the cousin and heir of William Wryght late of D. 14 Nov. 1483. Three small seals.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 222 Nicholas Flecknowe of D., husbandman, grants to Nicholas Catesby , esq., Edward Newenham, William Lane of Orlingbere, William Staverton, and Thomas Graunte , gent., (i) a cottage with a garden adjacent in D., between the prior’s tenement on the west, and that of Nicholas Welby on the east; (ii) 3 half acres in Staverton—one acre above Strutboroughe between the prioress of Catesby’s land and that of Thomas Bradele(?), and ½ an acre above Rowdone between Richard Heddon’s land and that of John Strychenall. He appoints Robert Lane his attorney to deliver seisin of the same. Given at D. Witnesses: Thomas Halle of D., Richard Maydewelle, … 14 Feb. … Rich. III.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 68 Joan Boteler, widow of John Boteler of D., grants to Nicholas Catesby , esq., Edmund Newenham, William Staverton, and Thomas Graunte, gentlemen, 4 half acres of arable land and 4½ roods of meadow in D. viz. ½ acre in le Longemersh by the prior’s land, ½ acre over Longemershe Hyll towards Crowehill by the prior’s land, acre over Langdon between the prior’s land; ½ acre under Houghton by the prior’s land: the meadow lies in the east meadow of D. John Boteler had held these of the gift of John Abbehowse and Nicholas Bateman. Joan has made Robert Lane of D., yeoman, her attorney to deliver seisin. Witnesses: Richard Maydewell of D., Thomas Hall of the same, Thomas Bate of the same, Thomas Berby of the same, John Scot of the same. Given at D. 30 Aug. 1488.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 223 Joan Boteler, widow of John Boteler of D., quit-claims to the same her right in ½ acre of arable land in the north field of D. … Langedone, between the prior’s land and that of Thomas … which they lately had by her charter. Given at D. 15 … 1489.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 224 Henry Smythe of West Haddon, yeoman, grants to the same gent (i) a tenement with curtilage adjacent in D., (ii) ½ acre of arable land in the west field of Drayton. Witnesses: Thomas Halle of D., Richard Maydewelle of the same, Thomas Arnold of the same, Nicholas Flek[nowe]. 11 March 1489.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 69 Henry Perkyn of Southam and Matilda his wife have made John Hayewode of D. their attorney to give Thomas Nassyngtone , clerk, Thomas Everdone of Snottescombe and John Yrmonger of D. seisin in their messuage in D. over Cornhulle between the messuage of Nicholas West and that of William Stavertone, with 4½ acres of arable land in D. and Drayton; and to deliver seisin to the same of another messuage in D. in le Swyneschepyng, which the grantors have for the life of Johanna late the wife of John Rede of N. Given at D. Witnesses: John Barkere, John Wyloughby, Simon Horn, Thomas Fissher, Robert Gissy, chaundeler. 24 Feb 1418.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 70 John Perkyn and Matilda his wife, by a fine, quit-claim to Thomas Nassyngton , clerk, Thomas Everdon of Snottescombe, and John Iremongere of D., two messuages and 4½ acres of land in D. and Drayton, for 20 marks. 18 Nov. 1424 and 20 Jan. 1425. (N’hants. ch. 98 is another copy.)

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 214 Thomas Everdon of Snottescumbe … grants to Thomas Nassyngton , clerk, Peter West, and John Keteryng, all those lands rents, reversions and services, &c., in D. and Drayton which they lately had jointly with the said T. N. and with John I. of D. by the gift of J. P. and M. his wife. Witnesses: … Thomas Fyssher, John Staverton, Hugh Cleydone. Given at D. [Mutilated.] … Jan. 1428.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 71 Thomas Nassyngton quit-claims to John Yronmonger of D. his right in a messuage in D. in Swyneschepyng, which Richard Style now inhabits, and which with the reversion of the same after the death of Joan Rede, widow of John Rede of Norton, he held with the late T. E. of S. and J. I. of the gift [as above]. Given at D. Witnesses: John Barker, Thomas Marche, John Staverton, Thomas Skynner, Thomas Randulle. 13 March 1445. Small seal.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 180 Indenture by which Nicholas, prior, &c., of D., grant to William son of Nigel of D., one acre of land in Draitone, in exchange for an acre outside D. on the east. Witnesses: Sir Walter fitz-Symon, Thomas (?) Gemme, John Baiuel, William son of Jordan, Roger the porter, Robert son of Nigel, John de Neubot, Henry the cook. 14 Feb. 1241.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 227 Indenture by which the prior, &c., of D. grant to Henry the smith of D., 1 acre and 1 rood of arable land in the south field of Drayton, in exchange for 1 acre of arable land in the north field of D. Witnesses: Sir Walter fitz-Simon lord of D., …, John Gemme, John Baiuel, … 1248.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xxxviii Thomas le Escriven of Drayton, for the soul of Adeline his mother, &c., grants to D. and the chapel of S. Mary. 12d. rent, viz. 6d. from his capital messuage in Drayton, by William de Preston’s messuage, and 6d. from a tenement in the same vill called Schulcroft. Witnesses: Walter de Walwardyngtone, William Gemme, Geoffrey le portere, Henry the smith, William Plumstone, Richard de Bowdone, Henry de Bukkeby, Richard Scop, Thomas Gaunt. 1250.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 20 Robert son of Roger de Navesby, quit-claims to D. his right in 15½ acres and 1 half rood, and 1 half acre of meadow in Drayton which Alice his mother gave them in free alms. Witnesses: Sir William vicar of D., Richard fitz-Walter, Jordan son of Nigel, John E … rig, Henry Fal …, … Neubolde, John of Haddon, Simon pu[g]il[a]tore. c. 1250–60.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 77 John Adam of Drayton, with the consent of Alice his wife, grants in free alms to D., for 14/-, half an acre of arable land, with a headrig of meadow, in the north field of Drayton, lying over Comppedemor at Longebreche between the land of Robert Gemme (which he holds from John fitz-Philip of D. for life) and the land of the said John (which Richard Wyt holds in villainage). Witnesses: Robert le Werur of Drayton, Geoffrey the porter, Simon of Morkote, Simon de aula in D., John Scop of the same. c. 1310–1320.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xv John de Newebolde, vicar of D. grants to D. and the parish church of D. 12d. rent. to the almarioso of S. Mary of the said church 6d. rent, and to the chapel of S. Mary 6d. rent. Witnesses: Walter fitz-Robert, lord of D., John fitz-Philip of the same, John Neel of the same, William de Draytone of the same, Baldewyn le champion of the same. 1291–1293.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 26 Henry the carpenter of Drayton and Agnes his wife grant to Simon de … and Adeline his wife ½ acre of arable land in the north field of Drayton. [Mutilated.] Witnesses: … Werrour of the same, Geoffrey Gamel of the same, … c. 1280–1300.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 229 Agreement by which John Fers of D. appoints Agnes daughter of Ralph le Coupere as his heir, to have at his death (i) two messuages in Drayton; one between the tenements of Walter the tailor (sartor) and John Fers, the other between the messuages of Adam le Waller and the said John; (ii) lands to the amount of ½ … in Drayton above H[ … ]rdys by the land of Geoffrey de aula, and a rood above Drayton Mawelond, on condition that she shall serve him faithfully to the end of his life, and pay 2/- to the chief lord of the fee. Witnesses: … le Werrour of Drayton, Symon de Aula of D., Symon Baudewyne, Jordan William, John Scop. [Mutilated.] c. 1290–1300.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 228 Henry Lodbroch of D. sells to Peter, prior, &c., of D., all his goods movable and immovable in Drayton. Witnesses: Geoffrey Gamel, John Adam, William le Wyte, Geoffrey le Rede, John le Werour of Drayton. c. 1310 20.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 21 John Scop in the new land of D., grants to Matilda and Emma his sisters all right he might have hereditarily in land which fell to Richard Scop in D., and a messuage by John of Knoston’s ‘placea’. Witnesses: John fitz-Philip, Simon de aula, Thomas de pistrina, Thomas le …, John Godchep. c. 1300–20.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 31 John of Knoston in D. and Lecia his wife grant to Thomas de Falusle for a sum of money a certain part of their ’placeta’, i.e. their chief house in D., which extends from their doors unto Thomas’s house and is in breadth from the highway towards their court 24 feet. Given at D. Witnesses: Thomas le Barkere, John Scop, Robert …, … le, Godefrey de spineto. Monday before … 22 Ed.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 36 John Bere son and heir of the late John Bere of D. grants to Roger the marshal of the same and Agnes his wife ½ acre of arable land in the south field of Drayton, lying above Crondonsichefur-long, between John of Knoston’s land and that which Walter Coleman held in villainage. Witnesses: Sir John fitz-Philip of D., John Neel of the same, Simon Baudewyne of the same, John Scoph of the same, Geoffrey de aula of the same, Thomas le Barkere of the same, … de Buckeby, clerk. 28 June 1308.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 78 Thomas de Falwesle grants to D. in free alms ½ acre of land in the west field of Drayton by D., over Mixeneforlong between the monks’ land and that of Geoffrey le Porter. Given at D. Witnesses: Simon de aula of D., Simon Baudewyne of the same, William de pistrino, Geoffrey de aula, John Scop, Jordan Balle, John le Werreur. 17 Feb. 1311. Circular seal, 1″, in black wax: S’ THOME DE FALVESLE. A cross composed of four ears of some kind of grain.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 79 Thomas le Eyr quit-claims to Peter, prior, &c., of D. the same half acre. Witnesses: Simon de aula, Geoffrey de aula, Simon Baudewyne, Robert Baudewyne, John le Werrour of Drayton, John Adam of the same. Given at D. 12 March 1316.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 230 Roger son of Lucy de Baddeby in D. quit-claims to Roger Mareshal of D. and Agnes his wife, for a certain sum of money all his right in ½ acre of arable land in the north field of Drayton, behind the hill by the land which Geoffrey son of Ralph held in villainage. Given at D. Witnesses: Michael de …, … John Scoph, Nicholas Colle (?), John le Barkere of D. 25 March 1316.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 45 John de Knostone in D., grants to Geoffrey son of the late Simon Adam of D., for a certain sum of money—arable land in the north field of Drayton. Given at D. Witnesses: Simon de gh …, Robert Simond, Geoffrey de aula, John [Her]berd, Walter de Buckeby in D. 17 Dec. 1316.
(ii) Land in Rowfurlong and Rushbeddes to the Chapel of S. Mary.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xxx William Gemme of Drayton grants to John son of Roger the miller of D. for his homage and service acre of land above Russhebeddes by William Coleman’s land in the north field of Drayton. Rent: id., for all service saving forinsec service to the King. Witnesses: Simon Mascre, Hamo de Bockeby, Baldewyne Campion, Scover (?). 1240–60.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xxxix Thomas son of Simon the butcher of D. grants to Robert de Welton and Agnes his wife for, 7/-, ½ acre of arable land in the north field of Drayton above Russchebeddes, between Simon de Morcote’s land and that late of William ad fontem. Given at D. Witnesses: John fitz-Philip, John Scop, Thomas Barkere, John Carpenter, Simon de aula. 10 April 1295.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xxxvii Geoffrey son of Geoffrey the porter of the priory of D. is bound to the sacristy of D. in a rent of 18d. Witnesses: Sir William the knight of D., Nigel, John Bayuel, John of Newebolde, Roger the porter, Jordan of Histrop, Simon son of Philip of Drayton, Luke of Welton. c. 1240–50.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xxxvi Agnes relict of Jordan Balle of D. and Robert, chaplain, her son, sell to Alan le Somenour of the same and Isabella his wife the pourparty of Alice, which fell to her on the death of Agnes her sister (sic) wife of Robert de Welton, viz. one ½ acre in the north field of
Drayton above Russchebeddes by the lord of D.’s land. Given at D. Witnesses: Roger of D., Simon his brother, Michael of Northampton, Robert Godchep, Roger Lucas of D. 12 March 1331.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xxix Isabella, widow of Adam le Somenour of D., sells to John de Braudestone of D., ½ acre of land in the north field of Drayton, lying above Russchebedds, by William le Rede’s land, which fell to her after the death of her elder sister, the wife of Robert de Welton. Given at D. Witnesses: John de pistrino, William de Stavertone, Robert Symond, William de aula, Thomas Bawdewyne of D., Richard the smith, John Adam of Braudestone. Monday, S. Andrew’s day, 7 Ed. III.In 7 Ed. III S. Andrew’s day, 30 Nov. 1333, fell upon a Tuesday.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xxvii Joan, widow of John de Braudestone of D., grants to John le Deye of D., chaplain, one acre [as in no. xx]. Given at D. Witnesses: Simon of D., Robert Simond of the same, Richard Taylour, John Gillyng of the same. 30 March 1349.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xxxii An incomplete copy of the above.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xx J. D. of D., chaplain, grants to Peter de celario of D. one acre of arable land in Drayton, which he had of the gift of Joan late the wife of John Braudestone of D., viz. ½ acre in the north field between Geoffrey le portere’s land and the high road to Leicester, ½ acre in the north field above Russhebedds by William Rede’s land. Given at D. Witnesses: Simon of D., John son of Sir Robert of D., kt., Robert Simond of the same, John Branfelde of Throp, Geoffrey Port ere of Dray tone. 30 March 1349.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xxviii J. D. grants power of attorney to John Cok , clerk of the priory of D., to deliver seisin to Peter de celario of the same. Given at D. 30 March 1349.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch.
