D. 6, no. xxxi Matilda daughter of Richard Gymme of Drayton grants to Richard Newebolde of D., one acre of arable land in Drayton, viz. ½ acre at Stenenforde, by the prior of D.’s land, and ½ acre above Roweforlong of Roger of D.’s land. Witnesses: John le Werrour, Thomas le Whyte, Geoffrey Porter of Draytone, Simon Newebolde of D., William West, junior. Given at D. 6 Nov. 1348.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xxv The same grants power of attorney to John de Burghersche to deliver seisin to R. N. of the same. Same date.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xxii R. N. of D. grants to John le cowherde of the priory of D. ½ acre of arable land lying over Rowefurlong by Roger of D.’s land. Witnesses: Thomas le Whyte, William Adam, John de Morcote, Robert de Godchep, John de Bragbroke. Given at Drayton. 14 Nov. 1348.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xxiii R. N. grants power of attorney to John de Burghnesc’ to deliver seisin of the same to J. le C. Same date.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xxxiii John le cowherde of the priory of D. grants to Juliana his sister ½ acre of land in Drayton over Rowforlong by Roger of D.’s land. Witnesses: John le Werrour, Thomas le Whyte, Robert Godchep, William Adam, John de Morcote. Given at Draytone. 8 Dec. 1348.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xxiv J. le c. grants power of attorney to Richard Rolf to deliver seisin of the same to J. Same date.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xxi Juliana Spencer of D. grants to Thomas Rede ½ acre lying over Rowefurlong by Roger of D.’s land. Witnesses: John le Werrour, Thomas le Wyte, Richard Godchep, Robert Godchep, William Adam. Given at ‘Daventry Draytone’. 14 Jan. 1349.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. XXXV J. le S. grants power of attorney to Richard Rolf to deliver seisin of the same to T. R. Same date.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xxxiv Thomas le Werrour of D. grants to John le Deye one acre in Drayton, viz. ½ acre lying in the north field over Rynhul by the prior of D.’s land; and ½ acre in the south field over Grenehul by the land of Agnes Weleys. Witnesses: Robert Symond, William Bawdewyne, Richard Godchep, Robert Godchep, William Adam. Given at D. 14 April 1349.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xxxviii? T. W. grants power of attorney to John le Burghersche to deliver seisin of the same to J. le D. Same date.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 56 Simon de Crek of D. and Sarra his wife, late the daughter of John Paynel, grant to Sir William Snow, chaplain 4 strips in the
east field of D. [as in D. 6, no. ii, part (i)]. Given at D. Witnesses: John de pistrino, William de pistrino, Simon de Newebolde, John Albord, Robert Simonde, Geoffrey le portere of Draytone, William de aula. 13 Dec. 1324. [D. 6, no. xiv is a transcript.]

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. iii John Snow of D. grants to J. D. and R. R. of the said 4 strips. Given at D. Witnesses: Simon of D., William Lande of the same, John Werrour of Drayton, Geoffrey Portere of the same, Robert Simond of D. 26 Jan. 1349.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. ii John Deye of D., chaplain, and Robert Rose grant to Peter, prior, &c., of D. all the land in D. and Drayton which they had of the gift of John Snow of D. and Thomas Roberd of the same, viz. (i) 4 strips of the gift of J. S. in the east field of D.—two lying by the Redewell over le Middelfurlong, between the land late of Agnes Martyn of Welton and that late of Robert Fyscher of Drayton; and two reach to Tunslade, between the land of the said Agnes, and that of Alice Cumfray; (ii) ½ an acre in Drayton of the gift of Thomas, lying over le Rowfurlong by the land of Roger of D.; (iii) a rent of 3/- which they had of the gift of John le Warde of Westhaddon. For 30 years. Given at D. Witnesses: Robert Symond of D., John de pistrino of the same, William Staverton of the same, John Werrour of Drayton, Geoffrey Porter of the same. 6 Feb. 1349.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. iv John Warde grants to J. le D. and R. R. the said rent from a messuage in Westhaddon, lying by the abbot of Sulby’s land. Given at D. Witnesses: Simon of D., Robert Simond of the same, John Werrour of Drayton, Geoffrey Porter of the same, John Braunfeld of Throp, William Sylo(?) of Mortone, Thomas Byfeld of Westhaddon. 26 Jan. 1349.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. vi John Dye and Robert Rose quit-claim to D. the same lands and rent in free alms. Given at D. Witnesses: Simon of D., John of D., Robert Simond of the same, John Wolf of Horepol, Simon Newebolde of D. 12 Feb. 1349.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. v Thomas Roberd of D. grants John le Deye, and R. R. the said half acre. Given at D. Witnesses: Simon of D., Robert Simond
of the same, John Bachous of the same, John Werrour of Draytone, Geoffrey Portere. Same date.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. lxv J. D. chaplain, and R. R., quit-claim to Peter, prior, &c., of D., in free alms, their right in (i) 4 strips of arable land in the east field of D., which they had of the gift of John Snow, (ii) ½ acre of arable land in Drayton which they had of the gift of Thomas Robard, (iii) a rent of 3/- which they had of the gift of John le Warde of West Haddon. Witnesses: Simon de D., John de D., Robert Simond of the same, John Wolf of Horepol, Simon Newebolde of D. 19 Feb. 1349.

MS. Rolls Northants. 9 Judgement of the precentor of St. Frideswide and the abbot of Dorchester (judges delegate) in a cause between D. and William de Rowille, rector of Braybrok, concerning an annual pension of 4/-. [Mutilated.] 30 Nov. 1286.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. lv Richard Fetsunpru of Brokhole quit-claims to John chaplain of Brokhole 6d. rent which Maurice of Botyndone used to pay him for half a virgate of land in B. Witnesses: John le campioun, William Valdyng, Adam Waldyng, William de Horepol, Henry the merchant, and his son. c. 1240–50.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. liv John Brokhole, perpetual vicar of Westhaddone, grants to D. and the chapel of S. Mary in free alms 5d. rent in Brokhole, which he used to receive from Richard Fetsunpru of B. Witnesses: Sir William then vicar of D., William Plumstone, Richard de Boudone, Henry the smith of D., John le campioun, Simon Waldynge, Henry le lord, Robert Seor’. 1240–50.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. lxi Gregory Grimbaut grants to D. in free alms, the whole service of that virgate in Broughton which William de fonte once held from him, viz. 42d. Witnesses: Robert de S. Germano, Philip Campioun, Stephen son of the rector, Alexander son of Reginald, Roger de Walde, William de fonte. c. 1250.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. lix G. G. grants to D. in free alms 42d. rent from the land which William de fonte once held from him in Brouton, as appears in another charter concerning the same gift. Every year the monks are to distribute 13d. of this to the poor (die absolucionis), and 2/5 is to provide a lamp before the altar of S. Mary, burning throughout the night, and at all masses during the day. Witnesses: Sir Walter fitz-Simon, lord of D., Sir Simon de Trop, William fitz-Robert de S. Germano, Philip Campion of Brutone, Stephen son of the rector, Alexander son of Reginald, Roger de Wode, William de fonte. 1250–55.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. lx Alice, widow of G. G. of Sidenham, quit-claims to D. her right in the said rent. For this grant the monks gave 5/-. Witnesses: William Plumstone, John of Neubaude, Henry the smith, John Broton, Thomas of Ely. c. 1250–60.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 4 Philip Grece of Buckby, son of William Grece, grants to D. in free-alms 12d. rent which they used to pay him for land which David, son of Ailmer held of the monks of the grantor’s fee in B. Witnesses: Simon fitz-Philip of D., Henry chaplain of D., Symon Campioun, Jordan the clerk of Draiton, Hugh Baiuel, Symon of Foxtun, Nigel, Jordan of London, William the clerk. c. 1200–1210.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 174 Peter of Goldinton grants to D. in free alms 2 virgates of land in Aldessebi of the fee of Cotes, i.e. those 2 virgates which his chapel of Caldessebi formerly held from the day of its dedication. Witnesses: Stephen the priest of Ravenstorp, Valeran of Hichelee, Walter Trucel, Reginald the Burgundian, Clement, William of Haldeneto, Cunald of Cotizbroc, Symon of Criaton, Osbert Trussel, and Richard his brother, William of Nortofiet, Henry the dean, Walter of Sportone, Ralph of Caldessebi, Henry de Mundeville, Robert the priest of Preston, Richard of Falweslai, Ailu’ de Urcheli, Matthew of Aiford, Richard his son, Gamel’ of Heddon’. c. 1170–80.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 175 William the skinner and Agnes his wife grant to D. in free alms a cottage and a plot of land in Cold Essebi by the grange of the prior and convent towards the east. Witnesses: Sir Adam vicar
of Cold Esseby, Adam fitz-Walter of the same, Walter a la Warre of the same, Roger ad fontem of the same, and Adam le Mundevylle of the same. c. 1280–90.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 176 Peter, prior of D., and rector of Cold Essebi, remits to the abbot and c. of Pipewell £3. 6. 0 out of £4. 10. 0 rent for tithes of corn and hay of the lordship, and 3 virgates of land belonging to Pipewell in Coldehasseby, in return for the grant of a part by Pipewell to Augustine le Waleys of Suthrigge and Maud his wife, for their lives. Given in full chapter at Daventry. 3 Feb. ‘mccc … gesimo secundo’.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 80 Thomas, prior of D., leases to Thomas abbot of Pipewell the rectory of Coldeashby for 90 years at £8 a year. On the death of the present vicar, Sir William Simond, they shall also have the vicarage for a further £10 a year. D. may distrain for either of these rents, and if they are not paid within 10 weeks of the due time D. shall receive a fine of 20/-. For every Sunday on which the prior and convent of D. are not ’rehersed and praied for’ in the Church, they shall receive a fine of 12d. [In English.] 20 March 1492.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 81 N. prior [&c.] of D. grant to William son of Bastian of Esseby a virgate of land in E. not to be alienated to men of religion, to hold from them as his father held it. Rent: ½ mark. Witnesses: Robert de Esseby, Yngold de Esseby, Adam de Mundeuil, Hugh the carter, Richard Friday. [Torn.] 1230–50.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 27b Margery, widow of Thomas le Jeovene of Evenle, quit-claims to Agnes her daughter her right in a third part of a certain messuage which Agnes has of her gift. Witnesses: Richard de Foxle, Thomas de Foxle,For this family see Baker, ii. 31. Ralph Thebaud, William de Mortone, Gerard de Cretor[er.] Given at Evenle. 29 Sept. 1323.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 82 Hugh, bishop of Lincoln, confirms to D. the church of Falwelle, which Master William had held from them. Witnesses: Master R. of Rolvestun, William the dean of Bergebi, Master Roger of Sumerford, Master Samson of Bergebi. 1186–1200.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 83 Indenture by which James, prior [&c] of D. grant to William son of Hugh of Northampton 3 virgates of land in Falvesle. Rent: 10/-. Witnesses: Robert archdeacon of Northampton,Two Roberts are possible, between 1210–31. After 1225 the succession of priors is certain. It therefore seems that there was a James, prior of D., some time between 1210–25. master Theobald master of the schools brother of the archdeacon, Henry the chaplain of D., Simon Campioun, master Thomas of Neuham, master Geoffrey of Doddeford, William the clerk. [Much torn.] 1210–25.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 84 Indenture by which Hugh de Capes, by the mediation of Hugh bishop of Coventry and Lichfield and Sir Roger de Weleton, grants to Nicholas, prior of D., his right in a pasture called Golecroft, and that the said pasture shall remain enclosed as Hugh Russel closed it: he further grants a capital messuage in Falville which Hugh Russel once held which shall also remain enclosed as Hugh Russel enclosed it. The houses of their tenants in Falville shall stand in peace as H. R. let them stand. Also the lane called Schiteburlane by St. Bridgett’s well, which Hugh Russel blocked up for the common utility of the manor of Falville, shall so remain: and the road which he opened for the advantage of the whole manor, by Golecroft, and which is called the road to the New Bridge, shall always remain a common road. In return the prior and convent have given him two acres of their demesne in Falville, and ½ mark rent for which he may distrain. Witnesses: Thomas of Wimundeham precentor of Lichfield, Walter fitz-Symon of D., Eustace de Watford, Symon de Trop, Master Stephen, dean of Norton, William de Esseby, Symon de Esseby. 1240–1.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 115 Indenture (in English) by which William Lane, prior &c. of D., grant to Richard Knyghtley esq., their pastures &c. in Fallewesly except the manor place, with remainder to his heirs. Rent: 18 marks. [Mutilated.] … June 20 Ed. IV.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 85 John Clerk, mayor of Northampton, William Austyn, gentleman man, Thomas Hunt, draper, William Heyrope, and William May late mayor, recite an affidavit of Thomas Arnold of D., scrivener, then 4 score years and more, that when 23 years or more he knew one William Tewe of Falwesle living in the lordship of the prior of D., in F., which lordship he had at farm. There was then a piece
of land ‘called Wynetpece now baynt’ in the Park abutting against Wynnethill and Rynehill, with a meadow at the south end called Wynnet Mede, broadening out from a rood on the west to a headland on the east. William also had a piece of his farm between Tarbard’s way sometime of John Badby. There had never been more than one farm in the prior’s lordship, of which Robert Young, John Frynde, and William Sroyft were tenants, having ‘meses’ and parts of the ‘ledes’ with the roods lying next to those of the prior. Also John Jones and John Curteys held 2 cottages and certain acres of the prior, but all these tenancies reached back to a date before Richard took the lordship to farm. There was no ‘several ground’ nor pasture in F., before Richard’s farm, except a piece called Holywell and another called Sewell, which were several from Candlemas to Michaelmas. [English.] 26 Sept. 1483.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 6 Thomas son of Ivo de H. grants to D. in free alms for the daily celebration of a mass in the chapel of S. Mary 12d. rent from a tenement which he held in Haverberg. For this grant the monks gave him 8/-. Witnesses: Richard de Lotrington, William Malesours of Lobeho, Hugh de Farandone, Sir Adam Bernard, Roger de Meyners of Boudone, Thomas Brabasun,N’hants. ch. 6 Braboun. Richard Cristein,Ibid., Enstein. William the clerk of H. 1288–1300. [D. 6, no. lxiv is a transcript.]

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 55b Ralph son of Isabella de Schrington in Horton, and Beatrice his sister grant to Hugh Osebern of H., and Juliana his wife, for a sum of money, 2 acres of arable land in H. viz. ½ acre in the west field above the shot called [Step]henhul by the land of the Master of the Hospital (in Northampton) of St. John the Baptist on the North; ½ acre in the same field between the land late of Geoffrey fitz-Simon of Hakelington and that late of William de Pateshull: ½ acre in the south field above a shot called … yerd by the messuage late of John of Knapetoft on the East; and ½ acre in the north field above a shot called Middelfurlong, between John of Merflet’s land and that late of John []. Witnesses: [] de Schrington, John Merflet, John fitz-Nicholas of [], Thomas le Barker. Given at Horton. 2 March 1326.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 24 Fourteenth-century transcripts, on paper, of two charters, by which William Malesovers grants to D. in free alms (i) a messuage and land which Richard of Thedingworth once held in L. Witnesses: Robert fitz-Walter, lord of D., Eustace of Watford, Richard of Lot[rington], Hugh Yrneyn of Thedingworth, Robert son of Adam of Langton, Robert son of the rector of [Halveton], Thomas, son of Ivo of Haverberg. 1255–65. (ii) a messuage and half a virgate in L. Witnesses: Sir Ascer, vicar of D., William of Scaldeby clerk of Sir Edmund, King Henry’s son, Roger son of William of Foxtune, clerk, Henry of Osbesston [], [] of Thedingwurth, Robert [] of Langeton, Robert son of the rector of Halveton. 1265–77.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 193 Promulgation of a sentence of the dean of arches concerning the tithes due to D. from Hugh Poer’s fee in Lubenham. Given at London. [Mutilated and much rubbed.] 26 July 1317.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 85a Transcripts of 6 writs in the Lubenham case:
(i) The archdeacon of Leicester to the abbot of St. James’, Northampton, acknowledging the receipt of a writ (dated 7 March, 1320), ordering him to cite Thomas de Wolwardington, rector of L., on the fifth court-day after the Sunday on which is sung ‘Jubilate’ [27 April.] to appear at St. Sepulchre’s, Northampton, to answer to D. Given at Leicester. 5 April 1320.
(ii) The dean of Gertr’ [Gartree] to the same, acknowledging a similar writ (dated 6 Oct. 1322): day of appearance to be the third court-day after November 2. Given at Bidlisdone [Billesdon] 30 Oct. 1322.
(iii) The same to the same acknowledging a similar writ (dated 5 Dec. 1322): day of appearance to be the next court-day after March 12. Given at Foxton, 26 Feb. 1323.
(iv) The same to the same: citation for fourth court-day after November 30 (writ dated ‘5 Non. Nov.’ 1322). Given at Billesdon, 24 Nov. 1322.
(v) The same to the same: citation for the court-day after the Sunday on which is sung ‘quasi modo geniti’ [3 April.] (writ dated 14 March 1323). Given at Billisdone, 22 March 1323.
(vi) The same to the same: citation for the third court-day after May 22 (writ dated 6 April 1323). Given at B. [] 1323.

MS. Rolls Northants. 6 Depositions of witnesses in the same case.
(i) …
(ii) William, rector of Bellesloe,
(iii) Robert of Keborth, rector of Sadyngton,
(iv) Philip, rector of Laughtone,
(v) Ralph, rector of Little Boudone,
(vi) Hugh, vicar of Scraptoft.
The year 1312 is mentioned. All the witnesses, except the last who was almost 50, are said to be 60 years old and more. [Mutilated and in part effaced.]

MS. Rolls Northants. 7 Proceedings in the same case, before the abbot of St. James, Northampton. 1322. Endorsed are two deeds about a claim to the tithes of a shot called Chardounbottes, belonging to the church of Bissebrok [Rutland.], before the official of Lincoln, in a cause between D. and William de Bellofago, rector of Seyton. 1321.

MS. Rolls Northants. 8 Royal writs, with the decree of John, bishop of Lincoln, in the same case. The last entry shows that D. claimed a fourth part of the advowson of L. [5 transcripts on 1 membrane, mutilated.] 7–16 Ed. II.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 86 One membrane containing three fourteenth-century transcripts: 28 May. 1323.
(i) The official of the Court of Canterbury orders the dean of Gertr’ to cite Th. de W., in a cause with D., concerning all the tithes of the fee of Hugh Poer in L., to appear on the next court-day after 24 June, in St. Mary’s, Aldermarichurch, London. Given at Keselingbury.
(ii) Royal writ to the official of Canterbury prohibiting the Courts Christian from hearing the case until an assize Utrum had determined whether a fourth part of the advowson belonged to the King or the monks. Given at Cowyk. [Yorks.]. 10 June 1323.
(iii) Another royal writ. [Much torn.]
(iv) Fragment of a mandate from the abbot of St. James’, Northampton.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 53 Proceedings on an appeal to the court of Canterbury in the same case. [Mutilated.] July–Aug. 1323.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 87 Indenture (in French) by which Peter of Harpol, prior &c. of D. grant to Mons. Thomas of Ferreis, ‘chief mees’ in La——and the tithes for three years. Rent: 10 marks at All Saints. Witnesses: Mons. Thomas Malesors of Lebenham, Nicholas of Vielstone, Nicholas Herberd, John of Vielstone, and Thomas Dyfeld. Given at D. –July. 1350. Circular seal, 1″, in red wax, a coat of arms and crest. [Illegiblé.] SIGILLUM · THOME · DE · FEREIS.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 30b Indenture by which John, abbot of [Evesham] grants to William le Freman of Newenham 3 acres of land called Astcroft and 3 strips and 3 butts by … of Newenhams land, and a plot called Luttlepassage, and another plot called Hardemede with the meadow called Muchelepassage, i.e. the land which they brought from William le Moyner of N. Rent: 11/-. Witnesses: Ralph Dolphin, Richard … grene, John le Dur, John Reynaud. c. 1300.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 63b Richard West of Newenham grants to Henry le Freman and Juliana sister of the said Richard, his pourparty of a plot in Newenham, by the said Henry’s messuage, with the reversion of the pourparty which Emma Lece holds in dower for life. Rent: a rose at Midsummer. Witnesses: John Dolfyn, Roger a Grene, John le Freman of Newenham, John le Caumpyon of Brochole, John West of Badby. Given at Newenham. 30 June 1334.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 66 William Leson of Neunepham grants to Henry Freman of N. and Juliana his wife for life 6½ acres of land in N. which he had of the gift of John of Buckeby. Witnesses: John fitz-Walter of Throp, Robert Power of Lyshebarne, Thomas le Yongelonde of Everdone, Henry Reynald of Baddeby, John le Freman of Neunepham. Given at N. 14 Dec. 1346.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 65 Alice daughter of William Lesen of Neupham quit-claims to Henry Freman and Julian [sic] his wife all her right in the lands which the said Henry and Julian had of the grant of William her father. Given at Throp by D. Witnesses: John son of Walter, William Herberd, Thomas son of Walter, Henry Le Barkere, William Kynt (?) of Throp. 17 Dec. 1346.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 73a Adam Neel of Newenham and Juliana … grant to John Warde of Catesby and Robert Rolfe a messuage and lands in Newenham, D., and Everdon, adjoining the said messuage. Given at N. [Witnesses illegible.] 30 Nov. 1368.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 82a William Freman of Newnham grants to Sir Thomas More, John Everdone of Snotuscumbe, Rector of Oldurton (?) Nicholas Bodynton, Thomas Goodman of Newnham … lands, tenements, pastures, curtilages, tofts and crofts &c. in N., and his water-mill. [Witnesses illegible.] Given at N. 4 July 1398.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 88 Extent of the lands and tenements in Newenham of Henry Freeman, son and heir of William Freeman—about a virgate in half-acre strips, as well as pasture, meadow, and a mill. [A roll.] c. 1403.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 82b Partition of the lands of William Freman in N. between the said William and Henry his son, by the view, discretion, and advice of Henry Colyns, chaplain, William West, John West, Thomas Muleward and the said William and Henry: William shall have (i) ½ ac. above Stonehulle, (ii) ½ ac. above Langdurenhulle and the butt above Haysythe, (iii) ½ ac. above Coksythe, (iv) ½ ac. above Clerkespath and a virgate above Langedone, (v) ½ ac. under D. wood, (vi) ½ ac. above Prentchegge, one Halfyerde under Norton wode, (vii) 2 virgates of Wythybed, (viii) ½ ac. of Middelforlong, (ix) ½ ac. above Holewellhulle, (x) ½ ac. above Scottesthorn, (xi) ½ ac. above Redlangedone, (xii) 1 butt above Edernstub, (xiii) 1 virgate at Horewey, (xiv) ½ ac. called Betwyxlangelonde, (xv) ½ ac. above Waterforlong, (xvi) 1 virgate above Coppudmore near the butt of Aldewynbuttes, (xvii) 1 butt above Berehullemershe, (xviii) 1 virgate ’betwyn the Sythes’, (xix) ½ ac. above Radewey, (xxi) ½ ac. above Janekynesgalle, (xxii) 1 virgate of Longelanglonde with half the mill. 1 Feb. 1403. Henry shall have (‘sibi per lottum contingent’), (i) ½ ac. above Lyttulehulle, (ii) ½ ac. above Wonelond, (iii) ½ ac. above Knanethorn, (iv) ½ ac. above Holewey, (v) ½ ac. and 1 virgate above Hemersyche, (vi) ½ ac. above Northlanglorde, (vii) ½ ac. above Musforlong, (viii) ½ ac. above Blakewell, (ix) ½ ac. above Flexhulle, (x) 1 ac. above Addeford, (xi) ½ ac. above Barellond, (xii) 1 virgate above Cruldyche, (xiii) ½ ac. above Catewell, (xiv) ½ ac. above Murlong, (xv) ½ ac. at the More, (xvi) 2 butts above
Watreforlong, (xvii) 1 virg. of Mulnehulle, (xviii) ½ ac. above Blachemondlond, (xix) ½ ac. above Lynto, (xx) 1 virgate over Dodeford, (xxi) 1 virgate over Muklehegge, (xxii) 1 virgate over le Stones by the virgate of Langedone. (xxiii) ½ ac. over Mulewelle forlong, (xxiv) 1 long virgate over Langedone, (xxv) ½ ac. over Janekyns galle with half the said mill. Given at Newenham.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 82c Nicholas Bodyngton of Newenham grants to Henry [Freeman] half of all lands &c. in N. with half the water-mill, which he, Thomas More, John Everdon, Thomas had [of the gift of William Freman.] Witnesses: … William West, William Iremonger. [Mutilated.] –6 July 1405.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 89 Indenture by which Henry Freman and Margaret his wife lease to Thomas Reyson and Elena his wife all the tenements, rents, &c. in Purstone, which they (H. F. and M.) lately had of the demise of John Westbury of Purstone and Agnes his wife. Rent: 40/-. Witnesses: Thomas Hetheringtone, Thomas Wayte, Roger Alayn’, John Barker of Daventre, William Greneleve, Thomas Greneleve, John Leurence, John Freeman. 24 Jan. 1420.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 82d The official of the archdeacon of Northampton certifies that the executors of the late Henry Freman, of Newenham, have rendered final account for his goods. Given at Northampton. 5 July 1447.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. liii Richard Gubynn of Northamptone grants to D. and the chapel of S. Mary, in free alms, that messuage which Cristian the mason once held from him in Northampton, in the cemetery of S. Guy’s. Rent: 27d. and two chickens at Christmas. Witnesses: William Tylley, mayor, Robert son of Richard, Robert of Leycester, junior, Michael son of Philip, junior, John Samson, Richard of Blyyeld the spicer. c. 1200–1220.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 234 Indenture by which Thomas, prior &c. of D., grants Richard Stone of Northampton, barker, Alice his wife and John their son, a messuage with a garden adjacent, in Northampton, in a lane called Mervelleshyllane, for their lives. Rent: 16d. Given at D.
Witnesses: John Baudewyne, John Tomkyn, William Hegel—of Northampton, barker, Robert Barette of D., barkere, William Kynge of the same. [Much rubbed.] 1452.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 90 Henry de Nuers et Juliana uxor sua omnibus hominibus et amicis suis et universis sancte matris ecclesie filiis, salutem. Notum facimus omnibus vobis nos recognovisse et reddidisse et ex parte nostra dedisse in perpetuam et liberam elemosinam ecclesie beati Augustini de Dauintre ius suum: ecclesiam scilicet de Northona cum omnibus appendiciis et libertatibus et consuetudinibus et omnibus rebus ad eandem ecclesiam pertinentibus, pro salute animarum nostrarum et antecessorum nostrorum, qui earn eidem ecclesie de Davintre longo ante tempore iniuste subtraxerant. Volumus ergo et precipimus ut iamdicta ecclesia de Davintre et monachi qui ibidem deo serviunt, earn libere possideant, et ab omni exactione quietam habeant. Et ut hec omnia rata sint et nullo possint impetu ire vel odii vel alio quolibet modo temerari aut violari, hanc recognitionem et redditionem et donationem ex parte nostra factam, presentis scripti testimonio, et sigilli nostri auctoritate confirmavi. Testibus: Willelmo presbitero de Falvesle, Symone presbitero de Daventre, Griff’ presbitero de Eddone, Willelmo presbitero de Weletone, Waltero filio Roberti, Philippo de Daventre, et eiusdem filius Willelmo, magistro Henrico, Johanne, Willelmo Gem, Thoma de Trop et eiusdem fratribus Waltero, Alano, Roberto de Trop et eiusdem filio Herberto, Gamel’ de Grafaa’, Nichola de Falvesle, Vincente de Weletone, Jordano clerico, Hugone Marm’, Johanne de Weletone, Willelmo parvo, Roberto fiere, Hugone Plumstone, Willelmo nepote priori Renn’, Willelmo Plat’, De hominibus et amicis Henrici, Gaufr’ de Cercedon, Willelmo filio Hamonis, Waltero clerico de Cercel’, Ber’ nepote Henrici, Willelmo Muschet’, Roberto filio Willelmi.In Mon. Ang. V. 182. num. XV. reading confirmamus for confirmavi and giving only the first four witnesses. 1191–8.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 91 Robert de Nuiers omnibus s. ecclesie filiis salutem. Sciatis me concessisse ecclesie S. A. de D. et monachis ibidem deo servientibus totum quod Henricus de Nuiers frater meus et Juliana uxor sua filia et heres Henrici de Chaudri fecerunt predicte ecclesie &
monachis de ecclesia de Norton. Recognoverunt enim eis ius suum: ecclesiam scilicet de Norton cum omnibus pertinenciis & libertatibus suis et reddiderunt et ex parte sua donaverunt et carta sua confirmaverunt quod ego ex parte mea et uxoris mee Marie pariter concedo et confirmo. Diligo enim ecclesiam et profectum ejus omnimodo cupio. In fratrem ibidem susceptus sum; et in die susceptionis fide affidavi in manu Philippi de D. quod actionem et cartam fratris mei et meam ubique dum vixero contra omnes homines pro posse meo guarantizabo; Testibus Willelmo sacerdote de Falwelle, Simone capellano de D., Philippo de D., Willelmo Gimme, Willelmo nepote prioris.This is in Mon. Ang. V. 182. num. XVI., which reads warantizabo, presbitero for sacerdote, and omits the last two witnesses. 1191– .

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 92 Letters patent of P[aul] abbot of Leicester, S[ilvester] prior of Kinelegurd, and Master Henry de Eston, reciting a letter of pope Innocent III ordering them to hear the dispute between J. priest, and the monks of D. who hindered his presentation to the church of Northnorton (Given at Rome 26 May. a° 1.), announcing that James has surrendered his claim and that the monks will give him 5 marks 5/- for his expenses. Witnesses: Adam the chaplain, master Gerard of Rowelle, Sir Theobald, master Geoffrey of Depint’e, canons, master Roger of Sumerford, Hugh ‘clericus domini Lincoln’.’ [Torn.] 1198.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 236 Admission by Henry the dean of Addon, and William de … of Master Gregory to the vicarage of Norton on the presentation of R. prior of Daventre, in place of Vincent, a son of the late vicar Thomas, who, having intruded himself into that church, had resigned it. Given in full chapter, at Nortone. Witnesses: William the priest of Falvesle, Rodbert the priest of Catesbi, Simon the priest of …, Roger the priest his brother, Richard the priest of W[el]tune, Arsgod the priest, Warner of Troph, Thomas de Trop, William Gulafre, William son of Henry of Norton, Walter son of Gamel. c. 1190–1200.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 179 Indenture by which Nicholas, prior of D., grants to Hugh de Brokhole, for his homage and service, that messuage which Robert Danegode formerly held of them in Norton. Rent 2/-. For this he gives one mark. Witnesses: … Roger de Whelton, … de Trop, Roger Golefre, Stephen the clerk, Ralph de Wa … [Mutilated.] 1250–60.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 237 Indenture by which PhilipI cannot read the ‘Philip’. It is in Turner and Coxe’s Catalogue. of D. demises to Nicholas de Ely, prior of D., a virgate of land in Norton, which William le Yreis and William l(e) Orl held from him, for 20 years. For this the prior gave him 20 marks sterling to assist him in his affairs. Witnesses: Sir Robert fitz-Walter lord of D., Robert Juvene of Everdone … Richard de Boudon, Henry the smith of D., Stephen of Norton, Alan de Murecote, Henry … [Mutilated.] 25 March 1260.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 238 Sir Philip of D., kt., has received of his lord, Nicholas, prior of D., the whole sum of money in which the said prior was bound to him for [the lease given in N’hants. ch. 237.] 1260.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 239 Confirmation by Sir William de Weleton [of no. 237]. [This is known from an endorsement: the charter itself is almost entirely effaced.] c. 1260.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 240 Indenture by which Richard son of William the knight of D. demises to Sir Nicholas of Ely, prior of D., a virgate of land which Ralph Nus le Po and Richard le Po held from him in villeinage, for 10 marks which the prior gave to assist him in his affairs. Witnesses: William, vicar of Norton, William Gulafre, Valentine de Norton, Alan de Morecote, Geoffrey the porter of D., Thomas de Ely. 29 Sept. 1263.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 9 Sir Philip of D. grants to Sir Nicholas, prior of D., in free alms, that virgate in Norton which Richard his brother has given them to farm (for 10 marks) for 10 years. Witnesses: [as in N’hants. ch. 240.] 5 Aug. 1263.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 235 Henry of Nortone, skinner, grants D. 6d. rent from Robert of Nortone, skinner, for a messuage which the said Robert once held from him, on the west of the cemetery against the church. Witnesses: Sir Hugh de Tywe, kt., Stephen son of the clerk of Norton, William ’ad aquas’, John le Ferrour, Henry le carpenter of Norton, Geoffrey Katerich, William Herbert. c. 1240–50.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. lii Henry of Norton, skinner, grants to D. and the chapel of S. Mary, (i) 2/- rent which Richard the cook once held from him, from
a messuage which John le Ferur once held, (ii) 6d. rent from the house of Robert the skinner. Witnesses: Sir Hugh de Tywe, kt., William ad acras de Nortone, John le Ferour of the same, Henry Carpenter of the same, Geoffrey Katryche of Trope. William Herberd of the same. c. 1240–50.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 35 John ? quitclaims to Michael de Norton of D. and Letia his wife, for a sum of money, all his right in 3 acres of land which they have of his grant. Given at D. Witnesses: John Scop, John Alberd, 1. Nicholas Celle of D. Sunday after the Nativity … 31 Ed.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 41b Mutilated and rubbed quitclaim of (?) John de Throp son of March Thomas de Capes … Witnesses: William de Neubold, John son of Sir Philip of D., Eustace de Burneby, John de B[ran]feld of Throp, John the heir of the same, John Capes of the same, Robert le Barkere of the same. 28 March 1317.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 43b John Neel of D. grants to John fitz-Thomas de Capes of Throp 1d. rent from Margery, widow of Thomas de Capes, for a messuage in Norton, also the reversion of 11/-, 2 hens, and 1 cock annually. Given at Throp. Witnesses: Sir John of D., John de Branfeld of Throp, Geoffrey Herberd of the same, Walter the miller of the same, John Capes of the same, Robert le Barkere of the same, John Bicunhul of Norton. 6 April 1317.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 93 Matilda, relict of William Bigge of Norton by D., releases to D. &c., all her right in that tenement in Nortone which they bought from her husband W. B., and which Philip le carter held. Given at D. Witnesses: Geoffrey de aula of D., Thomas Baudewyne of the same, Robert Baudewyne of the same, John Werreour of Drayton, Geoffrey Gamel of the same, William Adam of the same, Walter of Morkote of the same. 18 Nov. 1322.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 94 Matilda, relict of W. B. of N., quit-claims to D. her right in the same. Witnesses: John Herbert of Throp, Nicholas Golafre of Norton, Henry le Heyr of Weleton, John Martyn of the same, William Ace of the same, Symon de aula of D., Geoffrey de aula of D., John le Werour of Drayton. 18 Nov. 1322. Circular seal, ⅞″; a four-leaved emblem. + S’ WILL’S … MORCOT.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 95 John Boteler (alias John Couper’) of D. quit-claims to Wm. Catesby of Asshebyligger’, William Lane of Orlingber and William Staverton all his possession in Norton by D. (No witnesses.) 8 Jan. 1484.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 96 A second charter, of the same tenor, gives Richard Lane as John Boteler’s attorney for delivering seisin to the grantees. Given at Norton. 24 June 1483.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 241 Letters Patent of Edward III: License to D. to hold lands in Norton. [Partly effaced.] 9 Feb. 1368.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 78 Thomas de Newenham , clerk, grants to William, prior &c. of D., all the possessions which belonged to Thomas Muleward of Throp by Norton in Norton. Given at London. 28 Feb. 1388.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 97 William Pyn, junior, of Norton grants to John Rede of the same ½ acre of arable land with its headrigs and meadow in the West field of Norton, over Farlithil (?) under Borow between the land of the prior of D. and that of the prior of Combe. Given at Norton. Witnesses: Robert Gylus, John Wetyng, Thomas Bykenylt, William Clerk of Norton. 31 May 1391.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 98 The same grants to the same ½ acre 1½ roods of arable land viz. ½ acre in Norton over Marsdaleforlong between the land of John Whytyng and that of John Morcote which they hold from Sir Brien Cornybye, and of which ½ acre the headrig extends as far as Marsdaleselade: the 1½ roods lie above the shot which reaches to Aylushulle by the land of John Whytyng. Given at N. Witnesses: Robert Gylus, William Clerk, Richard Campioun, William Wryghte, John Whytynge of N. 6 June 1395.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 99 Agreement between William Rothwell, prior of D., and John Bischop, vicar of Norton, by D. J. B. is to pay tithes of a fee called Ynewatron, viz. 7½ virgates (Boundaries specified but partly illegible). Given at D. Witnesses: John [] of Heyford, John [Wa]undell of D., Thomas Gerreys of Marton, Robert Hauberk of D., John Heywode of the same, Robert Gy[lyns] of Norton, John Whiting of the same, [] Campioun of the same. 15 Aug. 1403.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 100 Grant from D. to Thomas Harres, of a messuage in Norton between the tenement of William Knyghte and that of the prior (in which William the chaplain now lives) with half a virgate as in the schedule. Rent 8/-. Given in the chapter-house. Witnesses: William Knyghte junior of Norton, John Knyghte of the same, Thomas Alyn of the same, Thomas Clerke of the same, John Bodyngton of the same. 13 Jan. 1491.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 101 ‘Per hanc cedulam indentatam declaratur tenura Thome Harres de omnibus terris et pratis que libere tenet de priore de D. in campis de Nortone iuxta D. predictam videlicet …’ (Total) in the East field 7 acres and a strip. ” ” ” South ” 5 ” 3 roods. ” ” ” West ” 5 ” a strip and 2 roods. i.e. 18 acres and 5 roods. The situation of each half-acre-strip, and the tenant on either side, is given. [Attached to D. 100.]

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 100 CopyMacray’s note: ‘probably written about 1474, see no. 109.’ of a charter by which William [ ] of [No]rton by D. and Joan Geffrey of the same grant to John Mauntell , esq., Thomas Tewe of Welton, John Chylton , clerk, Thomas Clerk of N., John Tewe of Welton, and Thomas Foderyngey of Welton, all their lands in N. formerly of Juliana Geffrey of N. Given at N. Witnesses: William Gyles, Henry Hendys, Thomas Benet, [] Bodyngton, William Chappleyne of N. 10 April 1432.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 120 Copy of a charter by which Thomas Foderyngey of Whelton grants to Sir William Baker, chaplain, of Norton, Thomas Bukby of the same, William Taylor of Dodford, and Emma wife of William Geffrey of Norton, all the lands in N. which he lately had jointly with John Mauntell , esq., John Tewe of Welton, Thomas Tewe of the same, John Chylton , clerk, of Norton, Thomas Clerke of the same, William Geffrey, John Geffrey of N. Witnesses: William Barrey, John Bodyngton, William Rous, John Chapleyn, William Fraunceys of Norton. Given at N. 12 Aug. 1466.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 110 Copy of a charter by which Emma, widow of William Geffrey, quit-claims to William Baker and William Taylor [N.B. Thomas
Bukby is dead] her right in the same lands. Given at N. Witnesses: Walter Mauntell, kt., Henry Mauntell esq., William Knyght of N., John Chapleyne of N., William Rous of N. 6 Aug. 1474.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 102 Copy of a charter by which W. B. and W. T. grant to the same Emma those lands in N. which they had jointly with her [etc.], with remainder to John Geffrey son and heir of William Geffrey and his assigns. Given at N. Witnesses: [As in N’hants. ch. 110.] 7 Aug. 1474.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 109 W. B. and W. T. grant power of attorney to Henry Clerke or Thomas Chamberleyne to deliver seisin of the same. Same date.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 242 John Boteler alias John Cowper of D. grants to William Catesby of Asshebylegger, William Lane of Orlingber’, and William Staverton, all the lands in Norton which he had from the late William Carrey of Norton, and appoints Robert Lane his attorney to deliver seisin. Given at Norton.N’hants. chs. 242, 243, 244, are copies, probably made in 4 Hen. VII, as the hand is similar to that of N’hants. ch. 245 (Macray). 24 June 1483.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 243 The same quit-claims [as above]. 8 Jan. 1484.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 99 William Lane of Orlynber, and William Staverton demise to Robert Mauntell, William Knyght of Norton, senior, John Knyght of Charwelton, Henry Clerke, John Falclyffe, and William Knight of Norton, junior, all those lands which they lately had jointly with William Catesby late of Asshebylygger’ of the gift of John Boteler alias John Cowper of D. They appoint Thomas Harryes and John Knyght their attornies to deliver seisin. Given at N. Witnesses: John Smyth of Muscote, Thomas Clerke of N., Thomas Aleyn of the same, William Bodyngton of the same, … John Benet of the same. 30 July 4 Hen. VI.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 103 John Geffrey grants to William Staverton of D., William Lane of Orlingbere, Edmund Newenham of Everdone and Thomas Lane, junior of D. [the lands which come to him under D. 102.] 21 Dec. 1486.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 104 The same quit-claims [as above] and as MS. Ch. Northants. 244. [Another copy] 20 March 1488.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 244 The same quit-claim as MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 104. [Another copy.] 20 March 1488.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 246 William de Orlingbere, Edmund Newenham of Everdon, and Thomas … confirm to John Mauntell … William Knyght of Norton jun., all the lands, rents, &c. in Norton; they appoint Edmund Newenham and Thomas Lane their attorneys to deliver seisin. Given at Norton. Witnesses: Thomas Clerke of Norton, Thomas Aleyn of the same, William Bodyngton of the same, John … [Mutilated.] 30 July 1489.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 245 Edmund Newenham of Everdon, gent., John Staverton, late of D., and Thomas Clerke of Norton, demise to Robert Maundell, William Knyght of Norton, sen., John Knyght of Charwelton, Henry Clerke, John Falclyffe, and William Knyght , jun., an acre of arable land in Norton in the Ferure called Crosseland Furlong, which they lately had of the gift of Thomas Lake of Trope, husbandeman, and Agnes his wife. They appoint Thomas Harryes of Thrope and John Knyght of Norton their attorneys to deliver seisin. Given at Norton. Witnesses: John Smythe of Muscote, Thomas Clerke of Norton, Thomas Aleyn of the same, William Bodyngton of the same, John Benett of the same. 30 July 1489.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 105 William Lane, prior &c. quit claim to Robert Maunsell, William Knyghte of Nortone sen., John Knyght of Charewelton, Henry Clerk, John Falclyffe, and William Knyght of Norton, junior, all their right in 1 acre of arable land in the field of N. by D. called Crosselonds furlong, which the said six have of the demise of Edward Newenham of Everdene gentilman, John Staverton, lately of Everdene, and Thomas Clerk of N. by D., in fee simple. Given in their chapter-house. 10 August 1489.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 247 Apparently a copy. [Mutilated.]

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 25 Memorandum of a return made by the archdeacon of Northampton to R., bp. of Lincoln, that whereas Geoffrey de Hanvyle had presented Matthew de Glynham, King’s clerk, to the rectory of Preston, by an inquiry it was found that the said rectory was not vacant and that the patronage belonged to D. Given at Norton. 10 Nov. 1266.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 32b Memorandum of an agreement between master … rector of Marsh, co. Bucks, and Sir Alexander, perpetual vicar of Great Preston, about the tithes of Little Preston. Given at D. 25 April 1292. An inquisition subjoined in another hand, taken at Preston, concerning the lands and tithes of Little Preston. 23 April 1297.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 186 Notice of an appeal, from a sentence by the Dean of Arches, by the proctor of D., in a suit with Stephen de Camvile, late rector of Merche. 1317–19.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 106 Record of case heard in All Saints, Northampton, before the Official of Lincoln, between Geoffrey of Sutton, acting for D., who claim the church of Preston, and Roger of Buckingham, acting for Stephen de Camvile, rector of Mersche. Witnesses for D. were: John Ilberd of Preston, Robert Boniour, Geoffrey Ivel, Gilbert Godfrey, Alexander Godfrey, John Russel, Henry ad fontem, Richard le Deye, brother Ralph of Wadford, Geoffrey de aula of D., Simon de aula of D., John Draper of D., William de Baddeby, Thomas de Falvesle, John Chocheman, Roger Cutte, William of Charwelton, Geoffrey Gamel, Robert le Baudewyne, Richard Jay, Guy of Mortone, John le Strange, Hugh le Cortiler, William Bigge, Hugh parcarius, William Whyte, Jordan Balle, John le Barker, Elyas de la Launde, John Wastere, Luke of Baddeby, Nicholas Selle, Simon Baudewyne, Robert Home, Nicholas de opere, William Snowe, Robert Paunsel, William Bocard, and Laurence of Preston. Adjournment to St. Frideswide’s, Oxford, on Tuesday after the Sunday on which is sung ‘Judica me deus’ [9 March]. 7 Feb. 1315. On that day D. produced 4 witnesses: brother Peter de Horpole, Henry de Kibbeworth, chaplain, Walter Selle of D., and Robert Coke of Preston. Accused produced none. Adjournment till Tuesday after the Sunday on which is sung ‘Misericordia domini’ [13 April], in St. Margaret’s, Leicester, and then to the court-day after 3 May, in All Saints. Tags for seals.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 47 A public instrument, drawn up by Robert Jordan, notary-public, at London, in the house of Robert de Reddeswelle opposite the Church of St. Stephen in Colman Street, being an agreement between D. and Master William Bacheler, rector of Mersch, in
settlement of a suit about tithes of the demesne in Little Preston commenced by the late Rector. 10 June 1319.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 113 Robert, prior &c. of D. grant to Richard of Linns for his homage and service, a place in Preston and two acres of land in the same which William Hert once held from them, viz.: 1 acre above le Gonbyshul, and the other at Caldewellepayd. Rent: 3/- to the Almonry. [Apparently only a copy.] 1425–1444.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xlii Reginald Lafe son and heir of the late John Layfe of R. grants to Peter, prior, &c. of D. and to the Chapel of S. Mary in free alms, 4/- rent from a messuage and land adjacent in R., which he bought from John his father. Given at D. Witnesses: Sir John of D., kt., Robert of D. his son, Eustace de Burneby in Watf’, William Brito, senior, of Tewe, William Brito, junior, of the same, Adam de Tewe in R., Geoffrey de aula of D., John le Werrour of Drayton. 22 Sept. 1314.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xliii The same grant in the form of a demise from Michaelmas 8 Ed. II for 100 years. Witnesses: Sir John fitz-Philip de D., kt., John Neel of the same, John Tewe, William Fodryngaye, William de Cotone, John Herberd of Haddone, John Herberd of Throp. c. 1314.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 12 The prior of St. Frideswide, Ralph of York and Richard of Feringkis, canons of Salisbury and Chichester, delegates appointed by O. cardinal of S. Adrian and papal legate, cite the prior of D. to appear in the church of St. F. Friday after St. Dunstan to answer to Master Hugh Hamelin and persons learned in the law why he took the rectory of Sandford, of which Sir Ralph of S. Laudo [Lo] is patron. 1267. 11 April

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 13 Letter of R[obert], prior of D. to the Abbot of S. Mary’s, Leicester. They have appointed brother William de Wengrave and John de Benewikt , clerk, their proctors in the case between them and Hugh Hamelin. Given at D. 1268 10 Sept.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 14 Declaration of John de Benewik relating to the appeal against Hugh Hamelin. [Mutilated.] c. 1268.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 15a The abbot of Leicester to the archdeacon of Leicester, about the dispute between the prior &c. of [ ] and [] chaplain. Given Wednesday, in the Abbey. [In the fragment which remains D. is not mentioned: Coxe and Turner attribute it to D.] c. 1268.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 15b Wednesday after Michaelmas … proceedings in the appeal between Master Hugh Hamelin on the one part and D. and William de Braybroc on the other. c. 1268.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 183 An act of court at Leicester in an appeal between Master Hugh Hamelin and the prior &c. of D., concerning the tithes of the church of Scandeford. 1268.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 16 In the church of S. Martin’s, Leicester, before the prior of S. Mary’s, Leicester, the archdeacon of Leicester, and the bishop of Lincoln, Master Hugh Hamelin seeks a postponement to allow him time to consider the process, of which he has obtained a copy. The case is adjourned till the morrow of All Souls, when the parties are to appear again in the same place. 1268. 4 Oct.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 248 Indenture by which D. leases to Robert Waltham of Scaldeford a croft in S. for 200 years. Rent: 3/- Given at D. Witnesses: … Richard of D., John Bachous of the same, John Braunfeld of Thrope … 29 Sept. 1343.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 249 Sentence of the official of Lincoln diocese in a suit of spoliation of the tithes at Scaldeford, at the instance of the prior &c. of D., against Robert Garton, rector of Waltham, his brother and others, condemning them to pay 6/- damages and 5 marks less a penny for expenses. Given at Lincoln. 1385. 18 May. [Seal.]

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 82 William, prior &c., of D. grant that since Richard de Assheby lately granted to a certain Hugh de Bronage and Mary his wife a messuage in Scaldeford called ‘Codyngton place’, which a certain Roger de Codyngton once took from Peter, prior of D., from
Monday after Easter 17 Ed. III [14 April 1343] for 60 years, the said Hugh and Mary shall hold it for the remainder of that term and for a further 10 years. Rent: 1/6. Given at D. 24 July 1393.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 251 Gilbert le Graunt (not Grait, as Coxe and T.; nor Graiser, as Macray) of Staverton grants to D. in free alms, 1 acre of land near Lorteulle. Witnesses: … Gilbert le Fraunceis … 1240. 15 April

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 10 Nicholas, prior of D., called to warranty by Emma Crok, recognizes by a fine made at Northampton the right of William de Morton in a moiety of half a virgate and a messuage in Staverton held at a rent of 18d. for the prior after an assize of mort d’ancestor had been summoned between them. For this William gave the prior ½ mark. 18 Oct. 1240.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 107 Margery, daughter and heiress of Laurence and Cicely French, grants to D. all her rent in Staverton from the lands which were held from her by reason of her inheritance in free alms. Witnesses: William Golafre of Norton, John son of Stephen of Branfelde of Throp, Henry the Smith, Thomas de Gaunt, Roger of Staverton, William West of D. c. 1250–60.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 250 Nicholas, prior &c. of D., demise to William de Depecrold (?) and Lucy his wife, a messuage in Staverton which Richard de Fleckeho (?) gave to them in free alms. [Mostly illegible.] c. 1240–50.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 32a John son of William Adam of Dra[yt]on grants to Thomas de Fallusle in D. ½ acre of arable land in the East field of Staverton extending to Hasacumbe, between the monks’ land and that of Roger Evermund. Witnesses: Simon de aula, Robert Waleys, Robert Gemme, Robert le Werrour, John Scop. Given at D. 21 June 1295.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xli Hugh de Bradewelle in Staverton grants to Alice his daughter a house in Stavertone, 2 acres [as above]. Witnesses: William West of Stavertone, Roger Evermond, Gilbert franciscus, Adam West, Thomas son of Bartholomew of the same. 18 Oct. 1302.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xlix Henry son and heir of Hugh de Bradewelle of Stavertone, quit-claims to Alice his sister his right in [the same]. Given at London. Witnesses: William Frances of S., John Frances of the same, Robert West, senior, Richard de aula, Nicholas le Ro, John Gunnild (?). July 1317–July 1318.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xliv Adam de B. leases to D. a messuage, curtilage and 2 acres of land in Stavertone (Rent ¼d.) which Alice daughter of Hugh de Bradewelle once held from him. For 20 years. Witnesses: William le Freynche of Stavertone, John le Freynche of the same, Nicholas le Ro of the same, Robert West, senior of the same, Simon Bawdewyne of D., Geoffrey de aula of the same, Simon Newebolde of the same. 21 Dec. 1319.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xlv A. de B. in Upper Kateby grants to D. the ¼d. rent aforesaid. Given at D. Witnesses: the same with the addition of John Drapere. Same date.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xlvii The quit-claim for no. xlv. Witnesses: William le Freynche of Stavertone, John Freynche of the same, Nicholas le Ro of the same, Robert West, senior, of the same, Richard de aula of the same, Simon Bawdewyne of D., Simon de aula of the same, Geoffrey de aula of the same, Geoffrey de aula of the same (sic). 23 Dec. 1319.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xlviii John Philip of Weltone leases to D. a house, &c., in Staverton [see no. xl]. Witnesses: the same, with the addition of Simon de aula, after Geoffrey de aula. 25 Dec. 1319.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 50 Agreement between John [Philip] and Alice his wife of the one part and D. on the other, concerning a house and land in Staverton. [Mutilated.] Witnesses: William le Freynche of Staverton, … West, senior of the same, Symon Baudewyne of D., Symon …, … Nichols. Prob. 25 Dec. 1319.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xl J. P. of W., Alice de Bradewelle, daughter of the late Hugh de Bradewelle, his wife, grant to D. a house in Stavertone, with part of a court, lying between the tenement of Adam Kynge and that late of Hugh de Bradewelle, with 2 acres of arable land in S. viz.
½ acre in the South field over Overcaldewellehul by Roger Evermond’s land and ½ acre in Combesmede; ½ acre in the north field under le Schonele by William Abbey’s land; one rood in Holecombe mede, one rood in Foxhole mede. Given at D. Witnesses: William Frennche of Stavertone, John le Frennche of the same, Nicholas Ro of the same, Robert le West, senior of the same, Richard de aula of the same, Simon Bawdewyne of D., Geoffrey de aula of the same, Simon de Newebolde of the same, John drapere of the same. 6 Feb. 1320.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. xlvi The quit-claim for no. xl. Given at D. Witnesses: William le Freynche of Stavertone, John le Freynche of the same, Henry le eyr of Weltone, Benedict of Draytone in Weltone, Simon Baudewyne of D., Simon de aula of D., Geoffrey de aula, John drapere of the same, Simon Newebolde of the same. 2 Feb. 1320.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 108 William, prior, &c., of D. grant to William Long, John his son and Agnes his son’s wife, and William and Alice, children of Agnes, 2 messuages with curtilages in Staverton. Given at D. Witnesses: … William Kent, John Willoughby, … John West, John … 21 Dec. 1394.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 107 Mutilated indenture by which William, prior, &c., of D. grant to John Couper alias Boteler of D., yeoman, and Robert Cokkes of Staverton, husbandman, all their tithes and oblations in Staverton for 12 years. Rent: 53/4 & the provision of a chaplain as vicar. Given in the chapter-house. 29 Sept. 1467.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 259 Ralph de Trop and his heirs grant to D. a mark of rent from(i) a virgate of land which he holds from them in W., viz. that which Hugh Lovel and Wido held, (ii) one acre in Trop, (iii) two virgates which he held of the same in Trop. Witnesses: John de Larchingelt, dean, Master Thomas of Neub[olde], Henry the chaplain, William fitz-John of D., Simon Campiun, Nigel, Alan Gemme, William his brother, John Baiuel, Phihp of Draiton. 1190–1200.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 5 James, prior of D., grants to Geoffrey Caterich and his heirs of Trop for his homage and service, the virgate in T. which Henry his father held, for a mark down and half a mark of silver a year.
He shall mow, reap and plough three times in the year. Witnesses: William de D., Ralph de Trop, Roger G——, Warner of Trop, Henry the knight, Simon Campioun, Nigel, Roger the porter. 1210–25.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 109 Inspeximus and confirmation of the following documents by John, Bishop of Lincoln. 14 March 1311.
(i) Richard, bishop of Lincoln grants the churches of Scaldeford, Bissebrok, and Southrop to D. (The amount they paid for it is not legible.) Given at Bukkedene, 27 November 1266.
(ii) Letters of the dean and chapter confirming (1). Given at Lincoln 21 April 1267.
(iii) Letter of the bishop to the archdeacon of Northampton to give D. corporal possession of the Church. Given at Leicester. 31 March 1286. (The Inspeximus tells us that this was on the death of Robert le Paumer, rector of Throp).
D. instituted as their vicar, John of Daventry, chaplain: it was then found that the tithes were worth (1) of grain 15 marks a year (2) of hay from demesne meadows 8/- (3) of hay from other meadows, (4) of 2 virgates 2 acres pertaining to the Church, with pasture 32/-, (5) All other tithes 3½ marks. The monks are to bear two-thirds of all burdens on the Church, and the vicar one-third.
(iv) Letters patent of Oliver, bishop of Lincoln to the archdeacon of Northampton to put John of D. in possession. Given at Theyden. 4 May 1286.
(v) Letters patent of the same (the same date) saying that at the instance of the monks he has written [as in (iv)] to the archdeacon. Given at Storne Park [Lincs.].

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 110 John son and heir of Thomas Capes of Thropp by D. grants to John Mylwarde of the same ¾ rent from a messuage and two virgates of land, which John of Braunfeld holds from the grantor in T. by D. with homages, wards, &c. Given at Norton. Witnesses: Thomas Dysonell, William Clerk, John son of Henry att Watre of Norton, John Herbard, William Herbard of Throp. 15 Sept. 1346.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 253 Thomas Michel of Throp grants to John Rede of Norton certain land in Throp beyond Churche weye. [Partly effaced.] 10 Aug. 1389.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 254 William atte Water of Horpolle quit-claims to Roger Perkyn of Throp and Alice his wife, his right in lands, &c., in Throp.
Witnesses: … Dyne, John Preston of Newenham, John Garlok, Richard Falclef. 25 March 1405.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 255 Quit-claim for N’hants. ch. 254, for the term of the life of the said Alice. Given at Throp. Witnesses: … Haldenby, Robert Laicup of Laintone Dene, John Preston of Newenham … [Fragmentary.] 1405.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 111 Alice Perkyns, widow of Roger Parkyns of Thrope by D., grants to John Parkyns her son of Throp all her land in T. and in Westone which they lately held jointly with the said Roger of the gift of William Wat of Horpolle. Given at T. Witnesses: John Boterell, John Garlyk, Richard Falclyff, Robert Harberd, Walter Braunfeld. 21 Sept. 1420.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 85b Richard Falcleve of Throp grants to Thomas Clerk of Norton and Simon Eyr of Falewesle, those lands, rents, reversions and services, &c., isn Throp which he had of the gift of Thomas Barker of Scafteworth. Given at Throp. Witnesses: Henry Chamber of Buckeby, William Hyrone of Falwesle, William Sutton of the same, John Perkyn of Throp, Robert Herberd of the same. 30 July 1421

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 112 William Harres of Thrope grants to Richard Chaumber of Thrope 2 acres of arable land, with headrigs in T., viz. ½ acre lying over Borowgh longe between the land of William Staverton and that of the prior: ½acre lying over Gladefarlong between the land of Richard Knyghtley and that of Thomas Bradley: 1 acre beneath Hayway between John Spenser’s land and that of John Falclaffe. He has appointed John Smyth of Muscot and Nicholas Cowley as his attorneys to deliver seisin. Witnesses: William Knyght, senior of Norton, William Knyght, junior of the same, Henry Clerk of the same, Henry Bakby of the same, John Brafeld of Thrope, and Thomas Harres of the same. Given at Trope. 3 April 1482.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 113 William Harres and Alice his wife quit-claim the same two acres to Richard Chaumber in fee simple. Given at Trope. 28 April 1482.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 256 William Staverton of D. grants to John Leeke of Throp and ] Agnes his wife a croft in Throp. [Mutilated and partly illegible.] 8 Nov. 1486.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 114 John Falclyff quit-claims to Edmund Newenham, William Staverton, and Henry Gryffythe his right in a messuage, croft, and half a virgate of land in T., which the said three, and the late William Catesby , esq., held jointly from him. Given at T. Witnesses: Nicholas Catesby, Esq., Thomas Graunte, William Knyghte of Norton, Thomas Leke, and John [] of T. [Torn.] 8 Jan. 1487. Circular seal, about ½”, in red wax: 3 ears of com: no legend.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 257 Thomas Leeke and Agnes his wife grant to Edmund Newenham, John Staverton, and Thomas Clerke, lands rents and services which they held jointly of the gift of William Newenham of Chenford, Henry Mitchell of Flor, esq., and … of D., gentleman, in Thrupe and Norton, and appoints Robert Lane of D., yeoman, his attorney to deliver seisin. Given at Thrope. Witnesses: Richard de Ynlond of Thrope, John Bukby, Thomas Harres, William Harres of the same, John Hele. 18 Dec. 1487.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 258 Indenture made at Thrope besyde D., by which William Harryes grants to William Lane, prior of D., a tenement with a croft adjoining in Thrope, and all appurtenances except one bay in the said tenement in which the said William now dwells, for 21 years. Rent: 4/-. [English.] 16 Jan. 1488.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 147 Indenture by which Isabel Brafeld, widow, John Colby, and Joan his wife agree to grant, by fine, feoffment, or recovery, all their lands in Thorp, Norton, and Welton, to Edmund Newenham, gentleman, in exchange for 3 messuages lying together in …, with other lands in Norton aforesaid. [Mutilated.] [English.] 31 Oct. 1491.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 161 Thomas Maydewell of Northampton, shoemaker, has received 5/- of annual rent from Thomas Ilston, prior of D. for land in Throp. [Mutilated.] 3 May 1500.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 115 Henry Archer , clerk, vicar of the church of M[an]devil by Throp is bound to Thomas Ilston, prior, &c., of D. in £4 to be paid at Michaelmas, if he does not pay 6/8 a year at Michaelmas. 30 January 1504.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. lxii Geoffrey the chaplain of Watforde grants to D. and the chapel of S. Mary 12d. rent from a virgate of land in W., which he holds from Sir Eustace and his heirs. Witnesses: Sir Eustace, lord of W., ’modo’ Edmund son of Eustace, Eustace Golafre, Richard Jonel, Alexander Michel. 1273.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. lxiii E. lord of W. grants to D. 12d. rent of his fee in W., which they have of the gift of Geoffrey the chaplain of W. Witnesses: Edmund de W., Eustace Golafre, Richard Ivel, Geoffrey le Chaunburleyn,i.e. Geoffrey Golafre, Deputy-Chamberlain of the Exchequer, presented by the Earl of Warwick, also had that office in fee, in 1273–4. (Madox, Hist, of the Exchequer, p. 732 et seq.) Alexander son of Michael. c. 1274.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 116 In the parish church of Bourton Statvir [Burton-upon-Stather, Lincs.] before Gocelin, canon of Lancaster, commissary general of the bishop of Lincoln in the cause [&c.]. Hearing postponed till Thur. after Ascension [7 June] in All Saints, Northampton. 25 May 1291.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 117 Oliver, bishop of Lincoln, to master Henry de Nassington, his official, committing to him [the same case]. Given at Burton Stathers [Burton-upon-Stather, Lincs.]. 25 May 1291.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 118 In a case heard before the bishop of Lincoln’s official in the church of All Saints, Northampton, between D. (actor) by master Roger de Bendone their proctor, and John Mallory, lord of Weltone, Symon Tuwe of the same, Robert Ace, Richard le Heir, Robert de Dunstone, Richard Martin, Richard the marshal, Henry son of Wille (sic) of the same (accused) by William de Baddeby , clerk, their proctor, by reason of burials in the chapel of Welton. Previous hearing by bishop of Lincoln at Bostone Stayers. Case postponed to [4 July] in S. Margaret’s, Leicester. 7 June 1291.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 119 Similar mandate, save that the day fixed is the court-day after S. Edward the King [18 March]. Same date. Endorsed ’venit Stamforde 6. Non. Oct. [10 Oct.] 1291’, followed by a summary of the letter of acknowledgement. [Partly obliterated.]

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 120 Mandate of the official of the court of Canterbury to the Bishop of Lincoln’s Official, to cite the prior, &c., of D. to appear at the court of the Arches on the next court-day after S. Andrew [30 Nov.] since the proctor of John Maulore [&c.] has complained [&c.]. 10 Aug. 1291. Endorsed: ’Venit apud Norht’. 7 Ides Novembrie 1291’ [7 Nov.]. [Partly obliterated.]
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 121 Mandate from the dean of the Arches to the bishop of Lincoln’s official [as D. 120]. Given at London. 23 Oct. 1291.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 122 The bishop of Lincoln’s official acknowledges a mandate from the official of the court of Canterbury received on 7 Ides. Nov. [see D. 120]. He has cited them to appear on the next law-day after S. Andrew the Apostle. Given at London. 28 Nov. 1291.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 123 Mandate from the dean of the Arches to the bishop of Lincoln’s official, to do justice notwithstanding the inhibition of the court of Canterbury. Given at London. 7 Dec. 1291.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 124 The dean of D. acknowledges a citation of Symon de Wymundham and Reginald de Heydone, officials of the court of Canterbury (sede vacante) for John Maulore, Simon of Tywe, Robert Ace, Richard le Heyr, Robert de Dustone, Richard Martyn, Richard the marshal, Thomas the clerk, Henry ale Grene, Richard Brown, Richard Lovel, William Brun, John super montem, Richard his brother, Henry son of William, Thomas the marshal, William son of Robert King, Henry Slay, William son of Thomas the miller, Richard Vincent, Agnes wife of Robert of Dustone, Eustace the porter, Alice wife of John Ingeland, Thomas the clerk of the same, ’ac totam communitatem ville de Welton’, to appear at the court of the Arches before the court-day after the Sunday on which is sung ’misericordia domini’. In the cause [&c.]. Given
at London [10 April] 1294. The Dean has executed this mandate, but John Maulore and Henry Slay are now dead. Given at D. 21 April 1294.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 125 A slip of parchment about 1½” × 3”. ’Nomina Somm[onitorum] Alexander de Snoscumbe chaplain, [Snorscumbe, Everdon parish, N’hants.]. Brother Oliver de Esseby Canonicorum. Henry of Wedone in D. Robert of Draytone in the same. William Wyleys in the same. Geoffrey child of D. William in angulo of Falwesle. John the clerk of the same. William le Eyr of the same. Geoffrey the cook of Haddone. William Giggel of Falewesle. John son of Gilbert of the same. William Parke of Haddone. Hugh of Booltone. John Slyman of D. [] [m]essor of Falewesley. Richard le Eyr of Trope. Richard Pyn of Nottone. xviii Jur’.’

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 126 Sentence of the dean of the Arches against the parishioners of Welton. The lord of W. and his accomplices had buried a certain Adam the reeve of W. in the cemetery there. His body or bones, and the body or bones of any one buried there after him, are to be exhumed, and buried by the monks in a suitable place. The parishioners are also to pay 30 marks costs to the monks. Endorsed: ’Lat’ fuit ista sentencia 12 Kal’ Augusti [12 July] Anno [&c.] 1296 Fodringh’.’
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 127 & 128 Notes of the pleadings for priory (D. 127) and parishioners (D. 128).

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 129 Notes used in the Welton case, ’Intendit probare procurator prioris [etc.]’, adding nothing, save that dead parishioners were always carried to Daventry and buried in the cemetery there.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 130 Philip son of Robert son of Roon of Hocton confirms to D. land in Welleton and in Trop which his father gave them in free alms, and releases them from 10/- which they used to pay his father for the forinsec service of the said land, and for which Robert de Braibroc attorned them. Witnesses: Walter fitz-Simon fitz-Walter, William of D., Simon Campion, Nigel, Geoffrey Campioun of Weletone, Roger the porter, Alan Gemme, William Gemme, John Baiuel. 1210–25.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 131 Henry de Braibroc quit-claims to J.The writing excludes John (prior 1269–81), as well as the attestation of Nicholas de Noers, who by 1256 was stricken with the palsy (Baker, N’hants. i. 414), and the death of the grantor in 1234. J. must therefore be James, for whom see D. 83. Nicholas de Noers was not of age till after 1210. prior of D. to the monks 10/- rentThis rent came from 5½ virgates held by Geoffrey Chatrick, William Herebert, and Richard super montem (Rot. Hund. 15). which ’J’ had in Weletona and Trop of the fee of Berkhampstead. Witnesses: Ralph de Brai, Ralph de Erligbere, Nicholas de Noers, William de insula, William de D., Simon of Maidwell, Richard of Bukereville, master Thomas of [], Simon Camp[ioun]. 1210–25.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 132 William [son of John Gemme of DraitoneFrom a contemporary endorsement.] grants to D. in free alms, 12d. rent from one virgateFrom a contemporary endorsement. in Weletone. Witnesses: Sirs Robert fitz-Walter, Philip of D., kts., master William Punte, William Plumstone, Henry the smith, Jordan of Uptrop, Simon Gamel. [Fragmentary.] 1255–c. 1265.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 133 Robert, prior, &c., of D. grants to Robert son of Robert Brown of D., for his homage and service ½ virgate and 6 acres of land with a messuage, which Hugh of Drayton once held from them in Weleton. Rent 16/-. Free of all services except forinsec service and suit to the monastic court. Witnesses: Sir Robert fitz-Walter, lord of Daventry, Sir Robert Mallore, kts., Semannus of Stokes, Robert Ace, William Hoc of Weleton, Geoffrey Katerich, William Herbert. 1264–9.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 261 William … de Welton grants to D. a portion of his court in Welton. Witnesses: Sir John fitz-Philip of D., … of Tuwe of Welton, John Martyn of the same, William ace of the same, John … [Mutilated.] c. 1300–10.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 134 Henry le Campion of Weleton grants to Thomas the tailor of the same, and Christiana his wife for money paid beforehand half an acre of arable land in the west field of Weleton at Cockesmedeoverende by the land of William Ace. Given at Weleton. Witnesses: Henry the heir, John Martyn, William Ace, John super Montem, John Norman of Weleton. 11 April 1312.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 40 The same to the same, for a certain sum of money, 1 acre of arable land and ½ acre of meadow in W., viz. in the west field ½ acre at … and ½ acre at Cockesmedeoverende … Given at W. Witnesses: John of Tewe, Henry the heir, John Martyn, William Ace, John Norman of W. 28 May 1312.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 42 A fifteenth-century copy of a charter of Henry Campioun of Welton granting another 2 acres of arable land and half an acre of meadow in W. The same witnesses. Same date.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 43a The same quit-claims to the same [the lands described under N’hants. ch. 273]. Given at W. Witnesses: John of Tewe, Henry the heir, Philip Martyn, William Ace, John Norman of W. 30 March 1315.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 273 Richard le Campioun son of Henry le Campioun of Weletone, quit-claims to Thomas the tailor of the same and Cristiana his wife for a certain sum of money, his right in 3 acres of arable land and 3 roods of meadow in W., which they had by the gift and sale of the said Henry his father, viz. in the west field, ½ acre at Wayetnesfel by the land late of John Martyn: 3 half acres lying together at Cockesmedeoverende by the land late of William Ace, and in 2 roods lying together beneath Le … Mor by the land of William de Caldecote; in the north field, ½ acre above Ferifurlong by the land which Robert le Noreys held in villainage; and in the south field ½ acre of meadow in at Mathewether by the meadow of John Malory; and in the east field, a rood of meadow in Overende, by the meadow late of William Hoycke. Given at
Weletone ’in itinere justiciar’. Witnesses: John of Tewe, Thomas Martyn, Henry the heir, Richard in gardino, Benedict of Drayton in Weletone. 18 March 1330.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 135 John son of Thomas , clerk, of Weltone grants to Richard super Montem a rood of arable land in the west field above Watlond between the land of the said Thomas and that of Alice le Campion. Witnesses: Robert ace in Welton, Richard the heir, Adam in gardino, Richard vron, John super montem, Richard Campion, Benedict of Drayton. c. 1340–60.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 136 Simon Vitor son of Simon Vitor of Northampton grants in free alms to D. the land which Richard Luvel holds from him in Welton, which he had of the gift of John Gemme at a rent of 8/-. The monks are to pay him 12d. a year and the ’hostilarius’ of D. is to receive the 8/- a year from Richard Luvel. Witnesses: Sir Walter fitz-Simon, William the knight, John Baiuel, William son of Nigel [] the porter, Roger the porter, William Plumstone. [Torn.] 1230–40.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 29a Robert Lovel of Welton grants to Benedict of Drayton in Welton, John Ossebom of Branteston and …, the rent which he used to receive from William Ketilburn. Witnesses; … John Martyn, Henry le Eyr , clerk. 1310–20.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 262 Richard Golafre of Watteford quit-claims to Benedict of Drayton in Welton and his heirs, right in 1½ acres 1 rood of land once of Richard Vincent in Welton. Given at D. Witnesses: John Malore, John of Tewe, John Martyn, Henry the heir, John Norman of Welton. [Probably a copy made c. 1380–90.] 22 Oct. 1315.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 49 Anastasia relict of Richard Luvell of Welton quit-claims to Benedict de Drayton of Welton all her right in [1 acre] in W. which the said Benedict had of the gift of Richard Luvell. For this Benedict shall pay 4d. a year. Witnesses: Henry the heir of Welton, John Norman, William of Culdicote, John Benett, Thomas of … [Given at] Welton. [15th-century copy ?] 27 May 1319.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 61 Richard son of Ralph Godfrey of Northkynelinworth quit-claims to [Benedict] de Drayton of Welton his right in — acres of land and the land called Hokeslonde. Witnesses: [] de Welton, Henry le Eyr of the same, Richard in Gardino, Thomas of Sadington, Richard super montem. [Mutilated.] July 1350–1377.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 137 Richard Drayton of Welton grants to John his son and Agnes his wife 2 cottages lying together with their curtilages in W. between his cottage and the prior’s tenement. Given at Welton. Witnesses: John Mallory, kt., Thomas of Tuwe, Henry the heir (heres), Henry Brokhole, John of Tuwe of Welton. 11 Jan. 1373.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 264 Richard Drayton of Wellton grants to John Attewell of W., chaplain, and John son of the said Richard in fee simple, all his lands in Welton and D. Given at Welton. Witnesses: John Mallore, kt., Thomas Tewe, Henry le Heyre, John Tewe, Nicholas Gybbe of Welton. 9 April 1379.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 265 John, son of Richard Drayton of Wellton, grants to John Attewell, chaplain, all lands, rents, services and reversions which Richard Drayton held in Wellton and D. Given at D. Witnesses: Thomas Tewe of Wellton, John Tewe of the same, Henry Eyre … Henry Brokhold of the same, Richard Smyth of the same. 5 Oct. 1382.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 76 Quit-claim for N’hants. ch. 265. Witnesses: Thomas Tewe, Henry le Eyr, John Tewe, Nicholas Gybbs and John Ynglond of Welton. Given at Wellton. 18 Oct. 1382.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 83 John Drayton of Welton and Agnes his wife grant to Simon Tuylo of Welton a messuage in W., with curtilage adjacent, between their tenement and the messuage which Thomas Othe-hulle holds from the prior of D., and a messuage which they had of the gift of Richard Drayton of Welton. Witnesses: John Malory, William Tewe, Henry Brokhole, Richard Smyth, John Falclens, John Warde of W. Given at W. 30 Sept. 1398.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 268 Richard Taylor, vicar of Fallewesley, appoints John, son of Thomas Slawston of Wellton, his attorney to deliver seisin to the said Thomas Slawston and Joan his wife certain lands in Wellton and Asshebyligger. Given at Wellton. 25 July 1402.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 269 Thomas Wright of Norton quit-claims to Thomas Slawston of Wellton and Joan his wife all right in the lands, rents, and services which were of John and Agnes Drayton. Given at Wellton. Witnesses: John Malory, Henry Brokhole, John Gybbe, John of the Hille, Richard Ynglonde. [Mutilated.] 25 July 1406.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 88 Agnes of Drayton, widow of John of Drayton, quit-claims to Joan Frend and John her son, son of the late Simon Taillour of Welton, all her right in two messuages in W. with curtilages adjacent. Given at W. Witnesses: John Malory, Henry Brokhole, Richard Smyth, John Falcleve, … Warde, Thomas Hulle. 31 Aug. 1404.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 87 Apparently a grant of similar import. [Fragmentary.]

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 267 Simon Taillour of Welton grants to John Malary , esq., Henry Brokhole, and Richard Smyth of Welton, two cottages with curtilages adjoining in Walton, between John Drayton son of Richard Drayton’s tenement and that of the prior of D. Given at W. Witnesses: Richard Ingelond, Thomas atte Hille, John Freend, John Fauclyf, John … barde. 15 June 1401.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 96a John Malory, Esq., of Welton grants to John Freend of Welton . . and Joan his wife, two cottages with curtilages in W., which John Drayton once gave to Simon Taillour. Given at Welton. Witnesses: Thomas Tuwe, … Ingelond junior, Henry Ingelond, John o’ the Hille. February 1419.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 270 Agnes widow of John Drayton of Wellton, grants to … Brown, clerk, and William Wright of D., all her lands in W. except 4½ acres. Given at D. Witnesses: John Malory, Thomas Frend, Henry Brokhole, Richard Smyth, John Gybbes. 30 Jan. 1439.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 62a Henry Eyr of Welton grants to —— Brown, chaplain, of the same, for a certain sum of money, all his goods movable and immovable in a messuage and virgate of land in Welton. Given at W. Witnesses: Richard de Hylle, Geoffrey the smith, Richard Martyn, Symon Eyr, Nicholas de Hylle. 30 March 1332.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 89 John Browne clerk, and William Wryght of D. grant to Thomas Slawston of Wellton by D. and Joan his wife, all those lands, &c., which the grantors had in Wellton. Given at W. Witnesses: John Malory, Henry Brokhalle, John Gybbs, John of the Hille, Richard Ynglonde. 7 July 1406.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 90 Although Richard Benett of Welton granted to Thomas Slawston of W. in fee simple a rood of arable land in W., late of John of the Hylle’s land, and two swathes of meadow, if the said Richard shall pay 20/- to the said Thomas at the feast of St. Peter ad Vincula, the said grant shall be null and void. Given at Welton. Witnesses: John Malory of W., John Gybbs, John of the Hylle, Thomas Frend, John Warde. 17 Jan. 1408.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 96b William Baron of Haverborugh quit-claims to Alice daughter of John Slauston late of Welton all her right in those lands, &c., in W. late of the said John. Given at D. Witnesses: Thomas Tuwe esq., Thomas Fyssher of D., William Brokhole, Richard Ynglond, John Othehulle of Welton. 10 Feb. 1441. Seal.

MS. Ch. Northants.
