Daventry 271 Robert Cl … of Asshebelegger, Thomas Hynkeley, and John Balches of Berughby demise to John Frende of Welton 2 acres of arable land and one rood of meadow in W., viz. ½ acre above Walese, 1 rood above …, 1 rood above Dedmorewey, 1 rood above Fyveacres of William Catesby’s land, ½ acre in the same shot by the prior’s land. Given at W. Witnesses: … Yngelond, …, John Warde, John Gybbe, Thomas Othehulle. 8 Oct. 1449.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 105 John Ayleffe, junior, of Asshebylygger and Joan his wife quit-claim to John Frend of the same their right in two acres of arable land, I rood of meadow in W. Given at W. Witnesses: John
Yngelonde junior, Richard …, Thomas Othehulle, John Warde, John Gybbe of W. 8 Oct. 1449.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 138 Indenture by which William, prior [&c.] of D. grants to John Wolf, perpetual vicar of Welton, for life all those lands and tenements in W. which … the prior’s bondman once held in villainage. Rent: 24/-. Given at D. Witnesses: Sir John Malori, kt., Thomas Tewe of Weltone, John Waundel of D. [Torn.] 8 Dec. 1377.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 108 Thomas Wolff of Welton grants to Robert Levesham formerly son of Richard Levysham, William Assheby, gentleman, John Horne, gentleman, Thomas Stanbrigge, William Fenall and William Perkyns all the lands in W. which were of the said Richard Levesham. Witnesses: John Ynglens’ of W., Thomas Stafford of the same, Henry Warde of the same, Thomas Spycer of D., Roger Debell of the same. Given at W. 12 June 1474.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 116a Robert Levysham son and heir of Richard Levysham and of Alice his wife, daughter and heir of Thomas Slawston late of Welton, grants to Robert Shawe all those lands in Welton which they had of the gift of the said Alice in her widowhood. Given at W. Witnesses: John Hylle, John Gybbes, William Warde, Richard Farman, Thomas Brygge. [Mutilated.] 12 Jan. 1481.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 272 Robert Shawe grants to William Catesby , esq., Edmund Newenham, William Staverton, and Henry Gryffythe one messuage, 22½ acres of land, and one swathe in Welton, and appoints Henry Warde his attorney to deliver seisin. Witnesses: … William Perkyns. 1 April 1483.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 102b Mutilated grant to William Catesby and others of a messuage in Welton near a holding of D. 10 April 23 Ed. IVTechnically this should be 1 ED. V., as Ed. IV’s reign ended on the 9th April 1483. 1483.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 159b Quit-claim to William Catesbye , esq., of certain land in Welton. [Fragmentary.] ?Hen. VI.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 263 William atte Wodecote quit-claims to Henry … his estate in a certain land called ’le Torree’. Given at Walton. [Partially effaced.] 40 Ed. III.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 116b Fragment of a charter settling a dispute about lands in Welton, in which William Puref[oy]…, … de Tywe, Thomas le Eschirmisur, Thomas de Holtesham, and John Golafre are concerned. Temp. Ed. III.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 79 Part of an enrolment of a decree of the commissary of the bp. of Lincoln in suit by D. against John, vicar of Welton, and Richard Falcliff, junior of the same, for burying the daughter of the said Richard in the chapel of Welton ’ loco notorie prophano, nullo modo dedicato’. 1391.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 266 Indenture by which Robert, prior, &c., of D. demise to Hugh haelmas … and Margaret his wife, a messuage with curtilage adjoining in Welton, for the term of their lives and that of Agnes their daughter. Witnesses: John Wyllughby, Robert Barker, … [Mutilated and partly illegible.] … Michaelmas 1440.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 91 List of names of 39 persons who owe tithe hay in Welton. Sum: 15/5¾. Endorsed with 12 like entries of tithe hay in Norton: 22½d. Sept. 1409–Sept. 1410.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 118 John Coylyn receiver of the rents of the prior of D., &c., of the house of Jesus of Bethlehem (of Shene) has received 13/4 from the prior of D. for a portion of the tithes of Welton. March 1481–March 1482.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 139 Robert son of Simon , clerk of Haddon gives to D. a rood of land in H., viz. at Cerllewelle between the land of the monks and that of Herbert son of Gamel. Witnesses: Simon de Trop, Simon Campion, Geoffrey Caterich, Robert de Trop, Stephen of Ravenstorp, Richard de Trop, Walter son of Geoffrey.This is in the same hand as N’hants. ch. 259 (Thorp.). c. 1210–20.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 3 John de Brochol, vicar of Westhaddon, grants to D. in free alms the whole of his tenement in W., which he once held of Sir Eustace
de Watford for homage and service. Witnesses: Eustace Golafre of Watford, Richard son of Peter of Holm, Ralph son of Walter, Ralph son of Herbert, Robert the clerk, Stephen le freman, Stephen son of Simon. 1220–30.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 232 Sir Eustace, lord of Watford, kt., grants to D. in free alms the whole of a tenement in West Haddon, which John, vicar of W. H., sometime held of him. Witnesses: Eustace Golafre of Watford, Richard son of Peter of Holm, Ralph son of William, Ralph son of Herbert, Robert the clerk, Stephen le freman, Stephen son of Simon.The witnesses are the same as in N’hants. ch. 3 (above), and it is in the same hand. c. 1220–30.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. lvii Henry son of Gilbert of Norton grants to D. and the chapel of S. Mary in free alms 6d. rent in W. H., from a messuage lying between the prior of D’s place on the north and that held by Geoffrey son of Susan from the prior on the south. Witnesses: Robert Waut’, William South of Haddon, Thomas South of the same, Richard the clerk of the same, Richard of Holm of the same, John Herberd of the same. c. 1290–1310.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 19 Robert Dolyn of Westhaddon grants to William son of Geoffrey the cook the same 2 roods of land in W. H., viz. one over Puttelesculde by the land of John Herberd, and one rood in Colecroft by the land late of Gilbert Mervyn. Witnesses: Robert son of Walter of Westhaddon, John Herberd of the same, Robert Richard of the same, Richard Wauter of the same, Thomas ——of the same, Robert le Warde of the same, John of Stowe. c. 1290–1310.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 23a Margery, widow of R. D., quit-claims to the same, her right in a third part of two roods, of her dower in W., viz. one over Colecroft by the land of William de Ravenestrop, and the other over le Lonewronge by the land of John Herbert, for a certain sum of money. Witnesses: John Herbert, Richard Walter, William of cotes, John le Freman, John of Stowe. c. 1310–20.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 57b Beatrice Goedlef of W. H. grants to Geoffrey son of John of Sept. Stowe, a house with a curtilage, near the tenement of Emma her sister. Witnesses: John Freman, John South, Roger Herberd,
Thomas (?) Yves, Robert le Warde, John de Stowe (interlined). Given at W. H. 14 Sept. 1321.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 57a Emma daughter of William Godelef of West Haddon claims to Geoffrey son of John of Stowe, her right in a messuage with a garden and croft which fell to her of the inheritance of her brother William in W. H. Witnesses: John Herbert of W. H., Richard son of Robert, William de Cotes, John le freman, John de Stowe of the same. Given at W. H. 8 April 1322.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 52 The same quit-claims to Thomas son of Richard Julian of the same, her right in the third part of an enclosed plot of land, with houses, buildings, &c., which Sarah her mother holds in dower in W. H. Given at W. H. Witnesses: John Herberd, William de Cotene, John de Stowe, Richard Wauter, Robert Richard [all of W. H.]. 23 April 1322.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 55a The same quit-claims to Geoffrey son of John of Stowe of West Haddon her right in a messuage, curtilage, and croft in W. H. which would have reverted to her on the death of the said Geoffrey. Given at W. H. 2 June 1325.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 58 William son of Geoffrey [] of West Haddon appoints John of Stowe of the same his attorney to deliver seisin to D of 3 acres of land in West Haddon. Given at W. H. 17 Aug. 1330.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 62b Thomas Weugh of West Haddon quit-claims to John Hulle of the same, junior, and the heirs of Matilda, widow of the said John, and their assigns his right in ½ the messuage he had of the gift of Richard of Olneye in W. H. Witnesses: Thomas of Byfeld, John South, William of Cotes, John le freman, William of Morcote, John of Stowe of W. H. Given at W. H. 3 July 1337.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. lvi John le Warde of Westhaddone grants to D. in free alms, 6d. rent in Westhaddon from a messuage by that of the lord of Weynewyk, to keep a lamp burning at the door of the refectory, at night, from All Saints to the Purification. Given at D. Witnesses: Thomas of Byfelde, John of Braufelde, Walter de Cotone, John of Stowe, Adam le Mortor’ (?) of D. 14 Feb. 1341.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no, lviii R. S. of W. H. grants to D. and the chapel of S. Mary 6d. rent from a toft and two strips of land in W. H. which Robert Hulle once held from him. Given at W. H. Witnesses: William de Extone, Walter Wyllam, John Knyth, William Warde, Richard of Olneya, Simon of D., clerk. 6 Feb. 1355.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 94 William Knyght of West Haddon grants to John Knyght his son, of the same, (i) a cottage and curtilage (extending from John Iue’s tenement to the Corncroft) with free entry and exit from the highroad; (ii) 2/4 rent from the tenement of Thomas Knyght his son. Given at W. H. Witnesses: John Andrew, William Warde, Thomas Assheby, Robert Simond, Robert Andrew, Thomas Thomas. 2 Feb. 1417.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 95 Condition of a bond in 20 marks from John son of William Knyth of West Haddon, to his brother Thomas, viz. to save harmless his said brother from all services, &c., for the lands, &c., in W. H. late of William Knyth their father. Witnesses: John Andrew, Robert Ormond, Thomas Asscheby, William Warde, Robert Andrew, Thomas Thomas of W. H. After 11 April 1421.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 140 Matilda, widow of Thomas Smyth of W. H., grants to Philip Kirkeby, chaplain of the same, all the lands and tenements in the same which she had of the gift of William Maydewelle of Waldegrave, John Gybworth of W. H., and John Sylkoc of the same. Given at W. H. Witnesses: John Andrewe, Thomas Assheby, John Ywe, John Sylcoke, Thomas Thomas de W. H. 18 Nov. 1423.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 104b William Dycon of Ravenesthorp, William Lolle of Bukton, and John Thomasse, junior of W. H., quit-claims to William Sylcok of W. H. their right in those 20 acres of land lying in W. H. which they formerly held jointly of the gift of the said W. Sylcok. Given at W. H. Witnesses: Thomas Weilde, John Olney, John Grane, Peter Wyrcet’ Webbe, Richard Moccote. 5 June 1448.

body.note:
Court Rolls, Rentals, and Account Rolls
D. R. 1–18.

div.p: MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 1 One membrane of a late 13th-century extent of the Priory lands. [Partly illegible.]
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 75 Memorandum of rents appertaining to the office of cellarer of D. [Half illegible.] Temp. Rich. II.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 2 ‘Prioratus de D. de officio celerarii.’ A rental dealing with Daventry, Drayton, Welton, Haddon, Staverton, Norton, Preston, Fawsley, Everdon, Buckby, Thorp by Norton. (2 ms.) c. 1400.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 3 Memoranda of services and rents of the priory [] Hen. VI., 1 and 2 Rich. III, and 1 Hen. VII in Daventry, Drayton, Norton, Welton and Staverton. (Much injured by damp, originally a book about 8″×4″ with paper leaves, and parchment cover formed out of a sheet of music.)
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 7 Terrier of lands in the west, north, and east fields of D. [3 ms.] 15 Cent.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 8 View of Frankpledge of Everdon, held at D. 6, 11, and 13–26 Edward III. [Torn and partly illegible.] (8 ms.)
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 60 Small fragment of View of Frankpledge of Everdon, held in the priory of D. 10 April 1353.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 4 Rental of D., Welton, (West) Haddon, Staverton, Norton, Preston, Fawsley, Buckby, Everdone. Total £20/2/2. 15 Cent.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 5 Terrier of priory lands in the [?north] field of D. [On paper.] 1483.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 6 Incomplete terrier of the priory lands. 14 Hen. VII.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 9 View of Frankpledge held at Fawsley. 21 Ed. III.–27 Ed. III. (8 membranes: much of nos. 1 and 2 illegible: no 3 is an estreat roll.)

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 10 Court roll of the Priory, comprising the View of Frankpledge and the ’parva curia’ at Norton. Dates:
10 Oct. 4 Hen. VI.
4 May ” ”
23 Oct. 5 ” ”
13 May ” ”
24 Oct. 6 ” ”
21 April ” ”
3 Dec. 7 ” ”
23 April ” ”

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 11 View of Frankpledge of Everdone held at D., and the ’parva curia’ of Norton held at D. 14 May 16 Ed. IV. 18 Oct. 20 Ed. IV. 21 Oct. 21 Ed. IV. 24 Oct. 22 Ed. IV. (Norton only.) (2 ms., on paper, in one hand throughout.)

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 86b Indented statement of the account of the cellarer Thomas de Watford, for the benefit of the new cellarer William Haddone. (It is not a complete account, but merely a statement of certain receipts and outstanding debts at the end of the cellarer’s term of office.) Temp. Hen. IV.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 12 ‘Recepta per priorem in officio celar”, Michaelmas 1404— Michaelmas 1405 (2 ms.) The items include— ’In redditibus £41/17/4¾. … de fructibus ecclesiarum, £81/14/5¾. … de lana nostra et decimali £11/17/5.’ Total £208/5/7½. Total paid out, £291/13/2¼ (including £60 of debt paid off).
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 13 Cellarer’s Account, Michaelmas 1413—Michaelmas 1414. [Torn.] Receipts £312/1/9.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 14 ‘Compotus fratris Willelmi Hadd’ Celerarii prioris de D., de omnibus receptis et expensis in eodem officio [&c.]’ Michaelmas 1429—Annunciation 1430.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 15 ’Compotus domini Thome prioris in officio celar’, pitenc’, earner’, et elemosinar’ anno 1447. Et anno predicti domini prioris primo.’ Receipts £86/4/3.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 16 ’Compotus Thome Knyght prioris prioratus de Daventre a festo sancti Michaelis archangeli anno regni regis Henrici sexti post conquestum xxviimo usque idem festum ex tunc proxime sequens anno dicti domini Regis xxviii, videlicet per unum annum integrum. Et anno dicti prioris primo.’ [1448–9.] Total receipts £166/4/3. Payments £196/0/2. [3 ms.]
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 17 View of Account of Thomas Knyght, prior of D., running from March 25, 32 Hen. VI to Michaelmas next. [3 ms.]

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 18 A mutilated and incomplete account roll of the priory (5 ms.). The whole of the ’discharge’ is given but nothing of the ’charge’. Mentions the burial of William Lane, prior, and the installation of his successor, Thomas Ilston. 1482.
MS. Rolls Northants. 5 ’Compotus [1 m.] fratris Jacobi Wittyngton in officio custodis capelle Beate Marie Virginis’ Michaelmas 1508–Michaelmas 1509.
